crew_archetypes.name: Commander Sela
crew_archetypes.flavor: Daughter of Tasha Yar and a Romulan officer, Sela worked to destabilize the Federation.

crew_archetypes.name: Sela in Shadow
crew_archetypes.flavor: This shadowy figure is the daughter of an alternate timeline Tasha Yar and is sent to drive a wedge between the UFP and the Klingons.

action.name: With Our Cloaking Devices, We Can Slip By You At Will

crew_archetypes.name: Devor
crew_archetypes.flavor: A mercenary who boarded Enterprise-D planning to use preparations for a baryon sweep as cover to steal trilithium resin.

action.name: You're Starfleet. You Won't Kill Me

crew_archetypes.name: Leck
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ferengi eliminator who cared more for combat than currency. He called out Quark’s attempt to cheat him, but also asked to join future jobs.

crew_archetypes.name: Damron
crew_archetypes.flavor: Damron was a Xindi-Reptilian scientist responsible for the development of a bio-weapon to destroy humanity.

crew_archetypes.name: Rayna Kapec
crew_archetypes.flavor: Rayna's feelings were supposed to be the final step in her development, according to her creator. But they are exactly what destroyed the android.

action.name: I Was Not Human. Now I Love. I Love.
All The Time In The World!

crew_archetypes.name: Android Mudd
crew_archetypes.flavor: Even Mudd's androids have a silver tongue and a hidden knife in their boot to try and weasel out of impossible situations.

crew_archetypes.name: Harry Mudd
crew_archetypes.flavor: A cunning smuggler, he manages to evade justice time and time again, only to move on to his next criminal pursuit.

action.name: Leo Walsh Is Me Name, Darling

crew_archetypes.name: King Mudd the First
crew_archetypes.flavor: Mudd would not have been Mudd if, having found himself on the planet where he was appointed king, he had not started his illegal affairs.

action.name: But Men Will Always Be Men No Matter Where They Are

crew_archetypes.name: Crewman Tarses
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Romulan-Human member of Starfleet who was assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise-D.

crew_archetypes.name: Lenore Karidian
crew_archetypes.flavor: A charming actress, she infiltrated the Enterprise, offering to put on a performance of Hamlet in order to kill anyone who knew of her father’s brutal past.

action.name: I Didn't Think We'd Be Meeting Again So Soon

crew_archetypes.name: Laas
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Changeling who matured in the Alpha Quadrant, Laas could take a wide range of forms including a warp-capable creature.

crew_archetypes.name: Xindi-Aquatic Councilor
crew_archetypes.flavor: As part of the Xindi council, the Xindi-Aquatic councilor debates with Archer over whether they were lied to by the Sphere Builders.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: First Officer onboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, Lieutenant Commander Spock would become a revered member of the Federation.

crew_archetypes.name: Recovering Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Recovering on Vulcan, Commander Spock spent much time retraining his logical mind.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: First Officer of the I.S.S Enterprise, Spock was a ruthless officer in the mirror universe's Terran Empire.

crew_archetypes.name: Ambassador Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ambassador Spock abuptly vanished, but appeared on Romulus assisting a Romulan-Vulcan reunification movement.

crew_archetypes.name: Kal-if-fee Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: As a combatant in the traditional kal-if-fee contest, Spock is forced to fight Kirk to the death.

crew_archetypes.name: Talos IV Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Prior to serving with Captain Kirk, Spock accompanied Captain Pike on an away mission to Talos IV.

crew_archetypes.name: Laborer Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Constructed a mnemonic memory circuit using 'stone knives and bearskins.'

action.name: Logic Is The Beginning Of Wisdom
I Am Well Able To Defeat You
Let Us See What The Future Holds

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Feeling a connection to the consciousness of V-ger, Spock stole equipment to seek his answers.

crew_archetypes.name: Fal-tor-pan Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: After undergoing the Fal-tor-pan ceremony, a revived Spock begins to put his fragmented memory back together.

crew_archetypes.name: Reunion Spock and Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: As Spock's memories return to him, Kirk with the crew of the Enterprise gathers around him in solidarity.

action.name: I have been and ever shall be your friend.

crew_archetypes.name: Tribble Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Spock suggests that the cause of the tribbles’ death was something in the grain they were eating.

crew_archetypes.name: Spock and I-Chaya
crew_archetypes.flavor: Spock is reunited with his childhood sehlat companion when investigating his own disappearance from history.

crew_archetypes.name: Platonian Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Spock is made a telekinetic plaything after failing to appeal to the Platonians’ sense of logic.

action.name: Take care, young ladies, and value your wine...

crew_archetypes.name: Prisoner Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: With the help of the Talosians, Spock shows Burnham how and why he escaped from the hospital and that he did not kill anyone.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Spock begins his tenure on the Enterprise under the command of Captain Pike.

crew_archetypes.name: Wizard Pollux Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Pollux the wizard, brother of Caster. Maybe Spock is another victim of the fantasy illusion from “The Kingdom of Elysian”, but my god! Look at that hair!

crew_archetypes.name: Spock as T'Pring
crew_archetypes.flavor: The soul-sharing ritual went wrong, but this could be a relationship opportunity for Spock. He deals with T’Pring’s duties in his own style.

action.name: This Is Coming Dangerously Close To Antics

crew_archetypes.name: Paradise Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: On Omicron Ceti III, Spock is exposed to euphoric flower spores that provide pleasure and enjoyment.

crew_archetypes.name: Valeo Beta V Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: While looking for survivors on Valeo Beta V, Spock must confront the terrifying force of his own emotions.

action.name: Captain, There's More Blood Over Here

crew_archetypes.name: Projector Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Spock finds comedy a difficult concept to grasp, as his blooper reel at the holiday party is more about pain than pleasure.

crew_archetypes.name: Henoch Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Spock's body was taken over by the Arretan Henoch, who, using Spock, intended to kill Sargon in Kirk's body.

action.name: Just Think How Much We Can Do For Mankind

crew_archetypes.name: Orion Hurricane Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Spock discovers that his arms have become too flexible. The crew begins to wonder what is really in the cocktails.

action.name: My Arms Don't Normally Do This

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Second captain of the Constitution-class Enterprise, Captain Pike is well known for his mission to Talos IV.

action.name: This Isn't The Only Life Available

crew_archetypes.name: Boreth Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Looking for a source of power for the Red Angel suit, Pike seeks answers on Boreth.

crew_archetypes.name: Enterprise Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Pike resumes his tenure as Captain of the Enterprise, despite knowing where his career will lead him

action.name: The Future Is What We Make It

crew_archetypes.name: Kiley Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Pike goes undercover on Kiley 279 to avert a nuclear conflict that should never have been made possible in the first place

crew_archetypes.name: Chef Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Intelligent, charismatic, handsome, and now he cooks?!! Is there anything Pike can’t do!?

action.name: Sometimes Things Go So Badly, You Just Have to Laugh

crew_archetypes.name: Amand Rauth Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Amand Rauth’s deferential demeanor was a thin veil for a truly treacherous nature that even Captain Pike’s charisma couldn’t hide.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Pike ends up in an alternate timeline where he escaped injury and became an admiral. But is it worth the sacrifices of millions of people and his loved ones?

crew_archetypes.name: Kalar Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Arriving on Kalar, Pike and his landing party discover that they are losing their memories.

action.name: I Need Our Memories To Come Back

crew_archetypes.name: Orion Hurricane Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Pike realizes his birthday might be better spent with friends and decides to enjoy his own surprise party.

action.name: Maybe I Should Celebrate With My Friends

crew_archetypes.name: Subspace Rhapsody Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Stuck to an improbability field, Pike and his crew find themselves in a musical reality where heightened emotions make them break into song.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Intent on being more than just a pretty face, Pike proved himself just as brutal as any other mirror denizen, including in how he took command of the ISS Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: Indomitable Pike
crew_archetypes.flavor: Pike finds himself trapped in Talosian illusions. He manages to find a way out - the Talosians are powerless in the face of unpredictability and emotionality.

action.name: There's A Way Out Of Any Cage, And I'll Find It!

crew_archetypes.name: First Maje Haron
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leader of the Kazon-Relora sect, Haron was killed when Maje Culluh beamed him into space.

action.name: What Small, Frail Creatures You Are

crew_archetypes.name: Krem
crew_archetypes.flavor: Krem is not the smartest of the pirate crew, and his Ferengi lobes don’t help when it comes to Archer's manipulation tactics.

action.name: I Don't The Have Lobes For Business

crew_archetypes.name: Six of Ten
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Klingon flagship officer who, after becoming a Borg drone, collaborated with Voyager and became part of the movement against the Collective.

action.name: Their Sacrifice Will Not Be Forgotten

crew_archetypes.name: Rumpelstiltskin
crew_archetypes.flavor: Fairy-tale character who appeared on the ship to observe the unique phenomenon of imagination.

crew_archetypes.name: Mike Burnham Sr.
crew_archetypes.flavor: An undercover operative posing as a xenoanthropologist, Mike is always ready to protect his family.

crew_archetypes.name: Disorderly Icheb
crew_archetypes.flavor: Icheb takes a stand against Seven’s methods of assimilating the recovered Borg children into civilian life.

crew_archetypes.name: Keyla Terrana
crew_archetypes.flavor: Keyla was a Tandaran disguised as a different species with unclear motives who tried to get close to Archer and question him about the Cabal.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Shelby
crew_archetypes.flavor: The once ambitious commander, now fleet admiral, spoke of Starfleet’s past and future on Frontier Day.

crew_archetypes.name: Vedala Elder
crew_archetypes.flavor: She gathered the expedition to retrieve the stolen Soul of Alar and prevent the Skorr from starting a holy war.

crew_archetypes.name: Assimilated Rooney
crew_archetypes.flavor: Researcher of the Arctic Archaeological Group. Was assimilated by the Borg and became a Borg drone.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Mendon
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Benzite, Mendon was instrumental in stopping a subatomic bacteria from destroying the Enterprise.

action.name: My Paws And Whiskers, I'll Be Late!

crew_archetypes.name: Crell Moset
crew_archetypes.flavor: Revived as a simulation named 'Medical Consultant Program Beta One,' Moset was a brilliant and unethical scientist.

crew_archetypes.name: Gorn Captain
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leader of the attack on Cestus III, the Gorn captain was made to fight Kirk by the Metrons.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Gorn
crew_archetypes.flavor: A hostile Gorn immediately attacks Spock, who has boarded the Cayuga ship.

crew_archetypes.name: Angela Martine
crew_archetypes.flavor: A phaser gun crewmember, Martine tragically lost her fiancé aboard the Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Vadic
crew_archetypes.flavor: Vadic and her team not only managed to escape from the trap, but also captured the Titan, getting even closer to their goal of capturing Jack Crusher.

crew_archetypes.name: Vadic
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hungry for revenge against the Federation for the torment they inflicted on her and the other Changelings, she helps a mysterious entity hunt for Jack Crusher.

action.name: How Very Precise With Your Timing

crew_archetypes.name: Morphing Vadic
crew_archetypes.flavor: The scientist who experimented on Vadic met a gruesome end, their form becoming a vessel for her vengeance.

action.name: You Gave Me The Ability To Mimic Your Blood
Society Could Use A Little Chaos

crew_archetypes.name: B.G. Robinson
crew_archetypes.flavor: A transporter chief aboard the Enterprise-D who quickly caught the eye of Captain Okona.

action.name: Able To Hang In A Firefight A Little Longer

crew_archetypes.name: Commando Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: As chief medical officer of the Enterprise, Doctor Crusher participated in the Celtris III raid.

crew_archetypes.name: Mok'bara Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: Beverly practices the Klingon art of Mok’bara to meditate, and also to pry into Troi’s love life.

crew_archetypes.name: Caldos IV Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: Beverly Crusher encounters an anaphasic lifeform tied to a family heirloom.

crew_archetypes.name: Century Nurse Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: Traveling back to the nineteenth century to save Commander Data from Devidian lifeforms, Crusher assumes the guise of a nurse.

action.name: Do you need any help, Doctor?

crew_archetypes.name: Battle Beverly Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: Without hesitation, Crusher opens fire on the masked bounty hunters that have infiltrated the SS Eleos XII to protect her son.

crew_archetypes.name: Brain Drain Crusher and Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Blood-curdling nightmare: Crusher, with a straight face, drinks 'something' from a straw that sticks out of Riker's head. It's just a dream, just a dream...

action.name: Do You Want Some? It's Delicious.

crew_archetypes.name: Stretching Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: During training, Crusher is happy to not only listen to Troi about her romantic experiences, but also support and give advice.

action.name: Who Needs Rational When Your Toes Curl Up?

crew_archetypes.name: Bridge Beverly Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: Beverly's skills were put to the test, but she managed to locate her son within the din of the Collective.

crew_archetypes.name: Idrin
crew_archetypes.flavor: Commander of a Hirogen hunting ship, Idrin captured Tuvok and Seven of Nine.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Rayner
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Captain of the USS Antares has a gruff manner, but it is the way his history with Moll and L’ak clouds his judgment that worries Burnham.

action.name: I See You Started Without Me

crew_archetypes.name: Gathorel Labin
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Sikarian magistrate who revels at the chance to host a “ship of aliens” and gain as much pleasure from their tales as his people can.

action.name: My Pleasure Will Be Greater Than Yours

crew_archetypes.name: Ephraim and Dot
crew_archetypes.flavor: Originally at odds, Ephraim and Dot helped each other out to escape a dire situation, becoming unlikely friends.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Morgan Bateson
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the U.S.S. Bozeman, Morgan Bateson was stuck in a temporal loop for nearly 80 years.

crew_archetypes.name: Gaila
crew_archetypes.flavor: Thanks to Quark, his fortunes faded, but that doesn't deter him from joining a mission to rescue Ishka, even if it's under a dubious promise for riches.

action.name: I'm A Weapons Dealer, Not A Soldier!

crew_archetypes.name: Gary Seven
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Class 1 Supervisor, Gary Seven spent his life on an alien world training for the day he would return to save Earth.

crew_archetypes.name: Alandra La Forge
crew_archetypes.flavor: The spitting image of her father, Alandra follows in his footsteps, joining Starfleet and helping to maintain the Fleet Museum.

crew_archetypes.name: Tallinn
crew_archetypes.flavor: As one of the mysterious Supervisors, Tallinn watched over and protected Renée Picard throughout the 21st century.

action.name: A Leap of Faith? It's Kind Of How I Roll

crew_archetypes.name: GI Chakotay
crew_archetypes.flavor: While Voyager was under the control of the Hirogen, Chakotay was made to play the role of an Army captain.

action.name: I Have A Lot To Learn

crew_archetypes.name: Union Chakotay
crew_archetypes.flavor: Costumed as a union officer, Chakotay leads the rescue to save Q and Janeway.

crew_archetypes.name: Amal Chakotay
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chakotay disguised himself as Amal to infiltrate a Quarren workcamp and rescue the brainwashed crew of Voyager.

action.name: Let Me Prove Who I Am

crew_archetypes.name: Dreamwalker Chakotay
crew_archetypes.flavor: Capable of lucid dreaming, Chakotay enters his unconscious mind to discover what is happening to crew who cannot wake up.

action.name: I Know This Is a Dream

crew_archetypes.name: Vori Defender Chakotay
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chakotay fights alongside the Vori as a Defender against the Kradin, without realizing he’s been placed within an indoctrination program.

crew_archetypes.name: Luau Chakotay
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chakotay is having a great time and resting up at the luau, not yet knowing what lies ahead.

crew_archetypes.name: Timeless Chakotay
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chakotay, along with Kim, are the only survivors of Voyager's collision with the ice planet. After 15 years, they return to the ship to correct mistakes and save the crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Homesteader Chakotay
crew_archetypes.flavor: Infected with an incurable disease, Chakotay and Janeway are placed on an unknown planet while a cure is sought.

crew_archetypes.name: Klingon K'Ehleyr
crew_archetypes.flavor: About to embark on a mission to re-integrate Klingons from a time of war, K’Ehleyr professes her feelings for Worf.

crew_archetypes.name: Third Remata'Klan
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Third Jem'Hadar, he loyally followed Keevan's orders, even unto his death.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Clark Terrell
crew_archetypes.flavor: The captain of the USS Reliant. His mind was overtaken by Khan but with a loyalty so strong he took his own life to protect Kirk’s.

action.name: What Do You Want With Us?
I Can Fix Stuff With Duct Tape

crew_archetypes.name: Flustered Jett Reno
crew_archetypes.flavor: Muddled with visions of the future, a flustered Jett Reno hurries to deliver the Time Crystal.

crew_archetypes.name: Temporarily Detained Jett Reno
crew_archetypes.flavor: Bored while she’s trapped on Book’s ship, Reno plays with her food and uses some black licorice to power a communicator to call for help.

action.name: I Have Something That Can Help

crew_archetypes.name: Agents Dulmur and Lucsly
crew_archetypes.flavor: Dulmur and Lucsly found themselves tasked with a humorless investigation into Sisko’s time aboard Kirk’s Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: T'Les
crew_archetypes.flavor: T’Les’ life becomes increasingly complicated as a result of T’Pol’s time aboard the Enterprise and her actions at P’Jem, even seeing her forced out of the Vulcan Science Academy.

action.name: There's More To Life Than One's Profession
Who I Am Today, I Will Be Forever
Do You Remember Anything At All?

crew_archetypes.name: Kago-Darr
crew_archetypes.flavor: A desperate bounty hunter who, in order to capture Archer for a reward, attacked his longtime rival, but was ultimately defeated.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Intendant Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Intendant of the Bajor Sector for the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance, Kira was captured by the Terran Rebellion.

crew_archetypes.name: Disguised Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Disguised as a Bajoran prisoner, Kira snuck into a Cardassian camp to rescue Resistance leader Li Nalas.

crew_archetypes.name: Cardassian Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kira was kidnapped and modified by the Obsidian Order in a plot to reveal the dissident Tekeny Ghemor.

crew_archetypes.name: Niners Kira Nerys
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kira joined Sisko's baseball team, playing shortstop for the Niners against the Vulcan Logicians.

crew_archetypes.name: Anastasia Komananov
crew_archetypes.flavor: After a transporter accident, Kira's image is used by a holosuite program to display a Soviet secret agent.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Kira Nerys
crew_archetypes.flavor: To facilitate contact with the Cardassian rebels, Kira was given a Starfleet field commission.

crew_archetypes.name: Breen Disguise Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: A disguised Kira helps Dukat see reason before harm comes to his daughter.

crew_archetypes.name: Luma Rahl Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kira travels back in time and poses as a comfort woman to learn the truth about her mother’s final years.

crew_archetypes.name: Prophet Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kira would have been willing to surrender herself to the Prophets no matter what the consequences, even if it meant her death.

action.name: I'll Try Not To Disappoint You

crew_archetypes.name: Hippie Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: While trying to find Sisko, Kira, along with O’Brien, ends up in the late 1960s, where they encounter a pair of hippies.

crew_archetypes.name: Surrogate Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Life aboard Deep Space Nine can be hectic, but nothing can stop Kira, even when she's carrying a baby for the O'Briens.

action.name: Sometimes Innocence is Just an Excuse for the Guilty

crew_archetypes.name: Lela Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Lela was Dax's first host and one of the first women to serve as a council member. Kira did not hesitate to host such a remarkable figure.

action.name: What is a Person, But The Sum of Their Memories?

crew_archetypes.name: Colonel Kira Nerys
crew_archetypes.flavor: Nerys keeps things running on Deep Space Nine, with a few curveballs from Quark every now and then.

crew_archetypes.name: Peldor Joi Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kira puts on a short but spectacular fire show - and the Bajoran Gratitude Festival begins!

crew_archetypes.name: Changeling Kira
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Female Changeling in the guise of Kira lures Odo to a deserted moon to find out why he chooses to live among the 'solids' - and how she can change his mind.

action.name: Get The Hell Off This Moon!

crew_archetypes.name: Leader Pav
crew_archetypes.flavor: The leader of the Trill government, Pav was conflicted about Adira’s joining with Tal.

action.name: Somehow I thought You'd Be Taller

crew_archetypes.name: Gul Madred
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Cardassian interrogator, Gul Madred was tasked with collecting the defensve plans for Minos Korva from Capt. Picard.

action.name: Why Talk, When We Can Dance?

crew_archetypes.name: John Frederick Paxton
crew_archetypes.flavor: A leader of the xenophobic Terra Prime, Paxton turned the Orpheus Mining Complex into a weapon in an effort to expel all aliens from the Sol System.

action.name: A Bloodbath is What You’ll Get

crew_archetypes.name: La'an Noonien Singh
crew_archetypes.flavor: La'an Noonien Singh was the chief of security on the USS Enterprise. She endeavored to keep the shadows of her past locked away.

action.name: Not Believing You're Gonna Die Is What Gets You Killed

crew_archetypes.name: First Monarch Kaitaama
crew_archetypes.flavor: Rescued from her abductors by Tucker, Kaitaama finds herself in a tense survival situation very different from her plush royal lifestyle.

action.name: Is Your Entire Species So Ill Mannered?

crew_archetypes.name: Nurse Paris
crew_archetypes.flavor: Flight Controller of the U.S.S. Voyager, he was haunted by his past in the Maquis and on the U.S.S. Exeter.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Proton Paris
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hero from The Adventures of Captain Proton, Tom Paris regularly took on the role in the holodeck.

action.name: For A Moment I Was Everywhere
Is This What You Call Enlightened?

crew_archetypes.name: Maquis Takeover Paris
crew_archetypes.flavor: Paris steps back into his Maquis identity to save Voyager from a holoprogram sabotaged by Seska.

crew_archetypes.name: Luau Paris
crew_archetypes.flavor: Paris slips into his classic Big Daddy-O Surf Special shirt before attending a luau with his crewmates.

crew_archetypes.name: Disguised Tom Paris
crew_archetypes.flavor: An aficionado of all things 20th century, Tom Paris still struggled to fit in amid people on Earth in 1996.

action.name: Is It So Unusual To Care About Something More?

crew_archetypes.name: Esteemed Tom Paris
crew_archetypes.flavor: It’s not every day an esteemed member of the ‘Voy’ visits the USS Cerritos, but when one does, Boimler is there to drool all over him.

action.name: This Is How we kick A## In The Delta Quadrant

crew_archetypes.name: Prisoner Paris
crew_archetypes.flavor: While serving time for working with the Maquis, Tom Paris was recruited by Janeway to locate the Val Jean in exchange for his freedom.

action.name: I'm Already Doing a Job For The Federation

crew_archetypes.name: Machine Man Paris
crew_archetypes.flavor: Fascinated by the study of an alien shuttle that he names Alice, Paris fails to realize he is falling into the vessel’s cunning and dangerous trap.

action.name: Argh! What Are You Doing To Me?

crew_archetypes.name: Facepalm Paris
crew_archetypes.flavor: An exhausted and frustrated Tom Paris has his head in his hands after a tumultuous time on the holodeck.

action.name: Thinking And Thinking. Trying Not To Think.

crew_archetypes.name: Morn
crew_archetypes.flavor: A talkative and frequent patron of Quark's Bar, Morn was often found enjoying a drink on his bar stool.

crew_archetypes.name: Mourned Morn
crew_archetypes.flavor: Morn faked his own death to avoid his associates’ attempts to steal his bequest. For once, silence pervades the bar at Quark’s.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. Tolian Soran
crew_archetypes.flavor: A survivor of the Borg destruction of El-Auria, Soran was obsessed with returning to the Nexus.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. David Marcus
crew_archetypes.flavor: Son of Admiral Kirk and Doctor Carol Marcus, David died on the Genesis Planet saving Lieutenant Saavik from execution.

action.name: It's Not The Weapon, It's The Soldier

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Mesk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Mesk had never been to Orion, but lied about being the son of Orion pirates. Quite successfully until his pirate skills were needed during a mission.

action.name: Everything I Know About Orions I Learned From The Holonovels

crew_archetypes.name: Spy Rumdar
crew_archetypes.flavor: This Pakled spy cannot really tell the difference between the Cerritos and the Enterprise, or between the bathroom and an airlock.

crew_archetypes.name: Mobile Doctor
crew_archetypes.flavor: Equipped with a 29th Century mobile holoemitter, this EMH was no longer restricted in movement.

crew_archetypes.name: Emergency Medical Holoprogram Mk.1
crew_archetypes.flavor: The first version of the EMH program in wide distribution, Voyager's EMH is the only one still in medical use.

action.name: The Back Nine at Gedi Prime?

crew_archetypes.name: Beowulf EMH
crew_archetypes.flavor: Due to his nature the Doctor was the only one able to rescue crew from the Beowulf holoprogram. This was his very first away mission.

action.name: Emergency! Get Me Out of Here!

crew_archetypes.name: Kenneth EMH
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Doctor explores nuclear family life by spending time with a holographic family of his own creation.

action.name: The Coffee Was Quite Good This Morning

crew_archetypes.name: Emony Leeta
crew_archetypes.flavor: As an amateur sociologist, Leeta was happy to take part in the zhian'tara ritual. She helped Emony relive her gymnastics career for a while.

crew_archetypes.name: Rites of Separation Leeta
crew_archetypes.flavor: While vacationing on Risa, Leeta and Bashir amicably end their relationship with the ancient Bajoran Rite of Separation.

crew_archetypes.name: First Clerk Leeta
crew_archetypes.flavor: Though her title is First Clerk, Leeta may be wielding more power than her position suggests. …or is she?

action.name: Also, The Nagus Would Like You To Dance For Him

crew_archetypes.name: Dak'Rah
crew_archetypes.flavor: Dak’Rah wanted to correct the mistakes of his past and became an ambassador to the Federation, but the past still followed him like a shadow.

action.name: But I've Been Doing The Best I Can
Everything I Said Was The Truth!

crew_archetypes.name: Renegade Locarno
crew_archetypes.flavor: Locarno’s resentment for Starfleet grew so intense that he decided to organize his own rebel fleet.

action.name: I Could've Been The Best Pilot in Starfleet!

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Diatta Ndoye
crew_archetypes.flavor: As a captain in the United Earth Force, Ndoye seems reluctant on diplomacy and more inclined to fire torpedoes. Maybe Saru will teach her a valuable lesson.

crew_archetypes.name: Judge Q
crew_archetypes.flavor: All-powerful judge and jury, Q placed the Enterprise-D's crew on trial at Farpoint.

crew_archetypes.name: Human Q
crew_archetypes.flavor: After being stripped of his powers by the Q Continuum, Q sought refuge on the Enterprise-D.

crew_archetypes.name: Sheriff of Nottingham Q
crew_archetypes.flavor: During his Robin Hood simulation, Q played the role of the Sheriff of Nottingham.

action.name: All It Takes Are A Few Good Men!

crew_archetypes.name: Lothario Q
crew_archetypes.flavor: Of all the females, of all the species, in all the galaxy—Q drops in to inform Janeway of his plans of becoming a parent.

crew_archetypes.name: Archaeologist Q
crew_archetypes.flavor: Q tempts Picard with trips to ancient civilizations to better understand history and archaeology.

crew_archetypes.name: Luau Q
crew_archetypes.flavor: In the Delta Quadrant, Q searches for long lost knowledge - romantic advice from Kim and Paris.

crew_archetypes.name: Union Q
crew_archetypes.flavor: Q takes Janeway to the Q Continuum recreating the American Civil War to try and explain to her why the Continuum is at war with itself.

crew_archetypes.name: 25th Century Q
crew_archetypes.flavor: Q pays Picard an unexpected visit that sets him off on a new path.

crew_archetypes.name: Dread Pirate Q
crew_archetypes.flavor: Q would be a tough pirate, wouldn't he? He’s had an eternity to build up an immunity to poisonous powders.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. Reyga
crew_archetypes.flavor: A brilliant Ferengi scientist, Doctor Reyga invented the metaphasic shield before his death.

crew_archetypes.name: Fascination Lwaxana Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Lwaxana’s mere presence at the Bajoran Gratitude Festival was enough for everyone around her to begin to open up about their secret feelings.

action.name: I Came To See You, You Poor Sweet Tortured Man

crew_archetypes.name: Bionic 5 Rutherford
crew_archetypes.flavor: Rutherford is cast in Mariner’s holonovel “Crisis Point” as Vindicta’s cyborg henchman, Bionic 5.

action.name: Tremble At The Sight Of The Great Vindicta!

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Rutherford
crew_archetypes.flavor: Rutherford loves being an engineer, and spends his free time talking about how great the Cerritos is with Tendi.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Rutherford
crew_archetypes.flavor: Rutherford uses his custom holodeck program to help Tendi learn how to spacewalk. Lessons were learned.

crew_archetypes.name: Chief Engineer Rutherford
crew_archetypes.flavor: During a drill, Rutherford’s attempt at an iconic heroic sacrifice is foiled by the mundane reality of pain.

action.name: I Have To, Son. I Am Chief Engineer.

crew_archetypes.name: Cadet Rutherford
crew_archetypes.flavor: Rutherford wasn’t always so earnest. As a cadet, he broke rules and caused chaos. But could there be a sinister cause behind his change?

crew_archetypes.name: Anbo-jyutsu Rutherford
crew_archetypes.flavor: Secret training with Boimler does not produce any results - they still lose in a two-on-one match with Mariner. Again.

action.name: Hopefully We Picked Up A Few Of Your Moves

crew_archetypes.name: Socrates
crew_archetypes.flavor: A part of the Emergency Medical Holoprogram’s personality enrichment program that led to unintended results.

action.name: I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing
When Are You Going To Do Something Interesting?

crew_archetypes.name: Perrin
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sarek's last wife. She was devoted to him and loved him, and did not doubt his love. She did her best to protect him during his illness.

action.name: I Know. I Have Always Known.

crew_archetypes.name: Interfaced Barclay
crew_archetypes.flavor: Enhanced by the Cytherians, Barclay created a neural interface to the Enterprise computer.

crew_archetypes.name: Cyrano de Barclay
crew_archetypes.flavor: In order to overcome his holodeck addiction, Barclay takes on the role of Cyrano de Bergerac before his shipmates.

action.name: The Moon...Yes, That Will Be My Home

crew_archetypes.name: First Contact Barclay
crew_archetypes.flavor: Barclay is thrilled at the opportunity to meet the inventor of the warp drive himself, Zefram Cochrane.

crew_archetypes.name: Barclay and Neelix
crew_archetypes.flavor: On temporary leave, Lieutenant Barclay returns to his apartment on Earth to spend time with his cat Neelix.

action.name: Sorry, He’s Not Used To Company

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Vasso L'Gaelia
crew_archetypes.flavor: During negotiations for a potential alliance, Captain Vasso left the Federation delegates baffled by his R’ongovian radical empathy.

crew_archetypes.name: Ambassador Sarek
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ambassador of Vulcan, he was the father of Spock.

crew_archetypes.name: Dignitary Sarek
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hiding his heart affliction, Sarek stands tall against a particularly tenacious Tellarite.

crew_archetypes.name: Legaran Delegate Sarek
crew_archetypes.flavor: In spite of Bendii Syndrome weakening his emotional control, Sarek is able to complete negotiations with the Legarans thanks to Picard’s help.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Shaw
crew_archetypes.flavor: Commander of the USS Titan-A, described by Riker as 'not a friendly face'  when he brought Picard and Riker aboard.

action.name: I'm Much More of a Malbec Man

crew_archetypes.name: Heroic Shaw
crew_archetypes.flavor: Once again faced with a Borg threat, Shaw sacrifices his life for his crew - even those he was most critical of.

crew_archetypes.name: Jhamel
crew_archetypes.flavor: A member of the Aenar subspecies, Jhamel used her telepathy to find and contact her brother through the use of a telepresence unit.

action.name: Halt In The Name of Chaotica!

crew_archetypes.name: Booker and Grudge
crew_archetypes.flavor: Booker is a courier who makes deliveries and smuggling goods in order to get enough dilithium to keep going with his queen, Grudge.

crew_archetypes.name: Sanctuary Booker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Booker went back to his home planet, Kwejian, to save it from the threat by Osyraa.

crew_archetypes.name: Breakthrough Booker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Booker cautions that pain isn’t how loved ones should be honored, and the 10-C understand. Their empathetic breakthrough halts the DMA.

action.name: That Is The Start of Making Things Right

crew_archetypes.name: Ikhu Zhen Booker
crew_archetypes.flavor: According to Kwejian tradition, Booker performed the Ikhu Zhen ceremony for his nephew Leto, when a boy becomes a man.

action.name: A Boy Only Becomes A Man Once

crew_archetypes.name: Q'Mau Booker
crew_archetypes.flavor: The landing on Q'Mau was especially important for Booker - here he had the opportunity to finally talk openly with Burnham after a long break

action.name: The Further I Am From This, The Better

crew_archetypes.name: Ilia Probe
crew_archetypes.flavor: Originally a crew member of the Enterprise-A, Ilia was destroyed and recreated as a probe by the entity V'Ger.

crew_archetypes.name: Hugh
crew_archetypes.flavor: Survivor of a Borg scout cube crash, Third of Five developed the spark of individuality and became Hugh.

crew_archetypes.name: Executive Director Hugh
crew_archetypes.flavor: A former Borg drone, Hugh became Executive Director of the Borg Reclamation Project.

crew_archetypes.name: Gilora Rejal
crew_archetypes.flavor: As part of the Cardassian Science Ministry, Gilora Rejal helped design a subspace relay in the Gamma Quadrant.

crew_archetypes.name: J'Vini
crew_archetypes.flavor: For a Qalankhkai, an oath is an unbreakable promise until it is fulfilled. Not even Starfleet officers can stop J'Vini in her mission.

action.name: Come After Me And Your Lives Are Forfeit

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Ro
crew_archetypes.flavor: A headstrong and proud Bajoran, Ro Laren assisted Captain Picard and his crew in tracking down a group of terrorists.

crew_archetypes.name: Maquis Ro Laren
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sent to infiltrate a Maquis cell, Ro Laren instead joined the fight against the Cardassians.

crew_archetypes.name: Insider Ro
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ro was recruited by Starfleet Intelligence, where she underwent intensive rehabilitation.

action.name: Blind Faith In Any Institution Does Not Make One Honorable

crew_archetypes.name: Wrathful Khan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Exiled by Kirk to the doomed planet Ceti Alpha V, Khan sought revenge for Admiral Kirk's perceived neglect.

crew_archetypes.name: Young Khan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ruler of a quarter of humanity during the Eugenics Wars, Khan escaped earth on the S.S. Botany Bay.

crew_archetypes.name: Ceti Alpha V Khan
crew_archetypes.flavor: On Ceti Alpha V, Khan did everything to keep his people alive. With the raise of a hand, he immediately has his peoples’ ears - and their trust.

action.name: I Was a Prince... With Power Over Millions.

crew_archetypes.name: Michael Jonas
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Maquis crew member who betrayed the combined crew of the Voyager to Seska and the Kazon.

action.name: She Knows That I Can Be Trusted

crew_archetypes.name: Gray
crew_archetypes.flavor: Now a part of Adira, Gray supports them unseen.

crew_archetypes.name: Second Chance Gray
crew_archetypes.flavor: Gray now has a new synthetic body of his own to finally interact with the Discovery crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Archer
crew_archetypes.flavor: First Officer of the 22nd century I.S.S Enterprise, Archer stole the U.S.S. Defiant from the Tholians.

action.name: Luck Had Nothing To Do With It

crew_archetypes.name: Camping Archer and Porthos
crew_archetypes.flavor: Archer takes Porthos on a research mission to a class M planet later known as Archer IV.

action.name: Going Where No Dog Has Gone Before

crew_archetypes.name: Twilight Archer
crew_archetypes.flavor: The anterograde amnesia from a parasitic infection leaves him confused and unable to serve as captain.

crew_archetypes.name: Carpenter Street Archer
crew_archetypes.flavor: Archer and T’Pol end up in 2004 Detroit and must stop the Xindi Reptilians.

action.name: Try to Stay Out of Trouble

crew_archetypes.name: Federation President Archer
crew_archetypes.flavor: After years of service in Starfleet and the Federation Council, Archer was elected President of the Federation, a post he held for 8 years.

crew_archetypes.name: First Flight Archer
crew_archetypes.flavor: Archer steals the NX-Beta, intent on proving the capability of his father’s warp engine and ensuring the NX Project proceeds.

action.name: Sherlock Holmes Has Nothing On You

crew_archetypes.name: Zero Hour Archer
crew_archetypes.flavor: Archer defeats Dolim and blows up the reactor to destroy the Xindi Superweapon once and for all.

crew_archetypes.name: Water Polo Archer
crew_archetypes.flavor: An avid fan of water polo, having made it all the way to North American regionals, Archer still keeps a memento in the form of a ball in his cabin.

action.name: One Part Basketball, One Part Swimming, One Part Wrestling

crew_archetypes.name: Surak Archer
crew_archetypes.flavor: While Archer’s carrying Surak’s katra, the father of Vulcan logic has much to share with him.

action.name: I Felt Something Inside... My Head

crew_archetypes.name: A.G. Robinson
crew_archetypes.flavor: The first human to break Warp 2 and survive ejection in an escape pod. Destroyed 1 of 2 NX Prototypes, almost ending the NX Project.

crew_archetypes.name: Toral, Son of Duras
crew_archetypes.flavor: After the death of his aunts, Toral attempts to take over the Klingon Empire alone.

action.name: What We All Want. The Sword.

crew_archetypes.name: Paul Mayweather
crew_archetypes.flavor: Though he resented Travis for leaving, Paul was able to fill his father’s shoes as captain thanks to some help from his brother.

action.name: You Do Remember How To Fly This Ship?

crew_archetypes.name: Grady
crew_archetypes.flavor: A mentally ill homeless man, he was convinced that aliens were visiting the Earth and that he could be invisible.

crew_archetypes.name: Prime Minister Nayrok
crew_archetypes.flavor: Angosian Prime Minister whose attempt to join the Federation was halted not only by rebellion, but also by Nayrok's unwillingness to be open.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Tasha Yar
crew_archetypes.flavor: Security Chief of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Later killed in action by an alien lifeform.

crew_archetypes.name: Warship Yar
crew_archetypes.flavor: Refugee of an alternate universe in which the Enterprise-C fought daily battles against the Klingon Empire.

crew_archetypes.name: Aviator Yar
crew_archetypes.flavor: Inspired by the holodeck adventures of O'Brien and Bashir, Aviator Yar was released in the Second Battle of New York event.

action.name: You Are Fully Functional, Aren't You?

crew_archetypes.name: Chef Neelix
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chef and morale booster for the U.S.S. Voyager, Neelix was infamous for his 'even better than coffee' substitute.

crew_archetypes.name: The Maitre de
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Maitre de was less than successful in his attempts to enforce the dress code when the Borg pursued Picard into his nightclub.

crew_archetypes.name: Nightless Neelix
crew_archetypes.flavor: Neelix tries to keep a clear head and keep morale up among the crew, but his own anxiety and nihiliphobia begin to consume him.

crew_archetypes.name: 1701 Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sisko, disguised as a crewman of the original U.S.S. Enterprise, worked to prevent the assassination of Captain Kirk.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: A privateer who served Intendant Kira Nerys in the mirror universe, he later led the Terran Rebellion against the KCA.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sisko had the heavy responsibility of leading Deep Space Nine through the Dominion War.

crew_archetypes.name: Promoted Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: Promoted to Captain, Benjamin Sisko was recognized for his accomplishments as Commander of Deep Space Nine.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. Hippocrates Noah
crew_archetypes.flavor: After a transporter accident, Sisko's image is used by a holosuite program to display supervillain Hippocrates Noah.

action.name: The Moment I Made The Decision
We're Not Who We Seem To Be

crew_archetypes.name: Desert Ben Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: Guided by a vision from the prophets, Sisko scours Tyree for the Orb of the Emissary.

action.name: I Know It’s Out There Someplace

crew_archetypes.name: Kal'Hyah Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: As Dax struggles with Klingon tradition, Sisko reminds his old friend what she must do and why she is doing it.

crew_archetypes.name: Sisko, The Emissary
crew_archetypes.flavor: With the Pah-Wraiths sealed away, The Sisko ascended to the Celestial Temple with The Prophets to continue his work outside time.

crew_archetypes.name: Joran Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: Commander Sisko risks his safety to take on the memories of the murderous musician Joran.

action.name: Do You Think of Me When You Play?

crew_archetypes.name: Night Writing Benny Russell
crew_archetypes.flavor: Inspired after meeting a prophetic preacher, Benny Russell writes the story of Captain Sisko late into the night.

crew_archetypes.name: C.O.P. Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: With a perspective outside of linear time, The Sisko is ready to guide the future of the Federation in Archer’s stead.

action.name: You Win Some, You Lose Some

crew_archetypes.name: Mother L'Rell
crew_archetypes.flavor: With a secret child, she made sacrifices for his sake, and for the sake of the Klingon Empire.

crew_archetypes.name: Crosis
crew_archetypes.flavor: An uncharacteristically individualistic Borg drone. Aboard the Enterprise, Crosis seeks to lure Data to Lore's side.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Arav
crew_archetypes.flavor: This Osnullus science officer has remained with the USS Discovery across time and space, through thick and thin

crew_archetypes.name: Tuvix
crew_archetypes.flavor: Created in a transporter accident, Tuvix was ultimately separated back into Tuvok and Neelix.

crew_archetypes.name: Ixtana'Rax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ixtana'Rax tried his best to prevent his commander from being tricked by the imprisoned Defiant crew, but he was completely ignored.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. Richard Daystrom
crew_archetypes.flavor: One of Earth's great scientists, Doctor Daystrom developed the M-5 computer to automate starship operations.

crew_archetypes.name: V'Las
crew_archetypes.flavor: Head of the Vulcan High Command, but ultimately a collaborator in a Romulan conspiracy where he intended to invade Andoria.

action.name: You've Failed. Decades of Work Have Been Lost.
Take Her Out For a Spin

crew_archetypes.name: Kivas Fajo
crew_archetypes.flavor: A collector of rare, strange, and sometimes illegal items, Kivas Fajo faked Data’s death in order to add the android into his collection.

crew_archetypes.name: KDF Alexander
crew_archetypes.flavor: Joined the Rotarran as a member of the Klingon Defense Force, against his father's wishes.

crew_archetypes.name: Tawi'Yan Alexander
crew_archetypes.flavor: Alexander’s change in deployment accelerates Jadzia and Worf’s plans to marry, where he serves as his father’s Tawi’Yan—or sword bearer.

crew_archetypes.name: Infected Tryla Scott
crew_archetypes.flavor: Parasitic beings have infiltrated Starfleet. While Captain Scott is amongst the first to suspect something is wrong, she unfortunately becomes infected by the parasite in the end.

crew_archetypes.name: Counselor Neera Ketoul
crew_archetypes.flavor: Neera serves as Una’s lawyer in her court martial. Skeptical of Starfleet, she works to show the injustice done to Una - and all Illyrians.

action.name: I Am Not The Biggest Fan of Starfleet

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Maddox
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Starfleet cyberneticist, Bruce Maddox attempted to disassemble Data for study.

crew_archetypes.name: Bruce Maddox
crew_archetypes.flavor: In pursuit of the truth, Maddox finds himself hunted by the Tal Shiar and chained by debt. His life on the run may be in greater danger than he realizes.

crew_archetypes.name: Metron
crew_archetypes.flavor: Finding the crew of the Gorn ship and the Enterprise to still be savage, the Metron pit the captains from each vessel against each other. However, Kirk’s decision to show the Gorn captain mercy impresses the Metron as well.

crew_archetypes.name: T'Pel
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tuvok's cherished wife and one of the many family members left behind after Voyager was flung into the Delta Quadrant.

action.name: To You, My Husband, I Consecrate All That I Am

crew_archetypes.name: Vedek Bareil Antos
crew_archetypes.flavor: A moderate member of the Vedek Assembly, Bareil stood againt Winn in the election of the new Kai.

action.name: I Am The Very Model Of A Modern Major General

crew_archetypes.name: First Officer Una
crew_archetypes.flavor: Una is a talented helmsman (and singer) serving as First Officer under Captain Pike on the USS Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: Huntress Z'ymira
crew_archetypes.flavor: It’s hard for Z'ymira to have a relationship with Sir Adya, having sworn her allegiance to the Forest. Still, she can be an ally to King Ridley

action.name: I Can Shoot It With An Arrow, If That Helps

crew_archetypes.name: Una on Trial
crew_archetypes.flavor: Arrested for concealing her identity as an Illyrian, the tribunal ultimately granted Una asylum and returned her to her post.

action.name: I Can Take Care Of Myself

crew_archetypes.name: Antedian Assassin
crew_archetypes.flavor: Masquerading as a dignitary, this assassin boards the Enterprise-D with his comrade to attempt a bombing at an upcoming conference.

crew_archetypes.name: Mr. Homn
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ambassador Troi’s valet. A man of few - or rather no - words. Very attentive, though sometimes it became irritating.

crew_archetypes.name: Qowat Milat G. Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: Finding herself back on Essof IV, Gabrielle joins the Qowat Milat order after they healed her. She serves as Michael Burnham’s shalankhkai before the Quorum.

crew_archetypes.name: Angel Gabrielle Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: Gabrielle evades the Klingon attack using the Red Angel suit, only to find out she is now stuck in the future timeline.

action.name: Time Is Not On Our Side

crew_archetypes.name: Kov
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kov served as an engineer aboard the Vahklas. He struggled with the decision to reconnect with his estranged, ailing father.

crew_archetypes.name: First Goran'Agar
crew_archetypes.flavor: Survivor of a crash landing, Goran'Agar was found to naturally produce the drug ketracel-white.

crew_archetypes.name: Changeling Founder
crew_archetypes.flavor: One of many Founders, this changeling commanded all Dominion activity in the Alpha Quadrant.

action.name: I Wish You Hadn't Done That

crew_archetypes.name: Martia
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Chameloid prisoner of Rura Penthe, Martia attempted to sabotage Kirk and McCoy's escape in exchange for a pardon.

crew_archetypes.name: Vic Fontaine
crew_archetypes.flavor: A self-aware hologram, Vic runs the 'Vic's Las Vegas Lounge' holoprogram popular among the DS9 command staff.

action.name: The Best Is Yet To Come
I'll See You In Hell First!

crew_archetypes.name: Klingon Dukat
crew_archetypes.flavor: After capturing a Klingon vessel, Dukat and his crew continued the Cardassian war against the Klingons on their own.

crew_archetypes.name: Dominion Dukat
crew_archetypes.flavor: As leader of Cardassia, Dukat delivered on his promise to retake Deep Space Nine from the Federation.

crew_archetypes.name: Pah-wraith Cult Dukat
crew_archetypes.flavor: Dukat founded the Cult of the Pah-Wraiths on the abandoned Cardassian station Empok Nor.

crew_archetypes.name: Breen Disguise Dukat
crew_archetypes.flavor: Breen Disguise Dukat

crew_archetypes.name: Rebel Calvin Hudson
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hudson joined the Maquis and played both sides, taking advantage of his position in the Federation.

action.name: Nobody Wants Peace Any More Than The Maquis

crew_archetypes.name: Wixiban
crew_archetypes.flavor: Neelix’s former associate whose reappearance threatens to take him down a dark path.

action.name: You're Living In A Dream World. It's Time To Wake Up.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Jadzia Dax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Science Officer of Deep Space 9, Jadzia is the latest in a line of Dax symbiont hosts.

crew_archetypes.name: 1701 Jadzia Dax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Transported to the past via the Orb of Time, Jadzia stopped a Klingon attempt on Kirk's life.

crew_archetypes.name: Sniper Ezri Dax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Using a modified TR-116 rifle, Ezri Dax fought a sniper's duel with Lieutenant Chu'lak on Deep Space 9.

crew_archetypes.name: Blood Oath Jadzia Dax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Honoring an oath made by Curzon, Jadzia avenged the sons of Kang, Koloth, and Kor.

crew_archetypes.name: Klingon Bride Jadzia
crew_archetypes.flavor: Jadzia chose traditional Klingon wedding attire for her marriage to Lieutenant Commander Worf.

crew_archetypes.name: Princess Jadzia
crew_archetypes.flavor: In an attempt to entertain Major Kira, Jadzia arranged a visit to a Camelot holoprogram.

action.name: It's about time you came back
We Have to Find My Friends

crew_archetypes.name: Esteemed Curzon Dax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Seventh host of the Dax symbiont, a close friend and mentor of Sisko, and an excellent diplomat.

action.name: Aren't You Happy To See Me?

crew_archetypes.name: Yedrin Dax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Yedrin is a descendant of Jadzia and current host of the Dax symbiont, who also bears the guilt of his ancestor's mistake.

action.name: What are you going to do about it?

crew_archetypes.name: Returning Ezri Dax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ezri never imagined that visiting her family would result in her brother's imprisonment. Another victim of her mother's high expectations.

action.name: I Should Have Gone Home a Long Time Ago.

crew_archetypes.name: Symbiont Pool Jadzia
crew_archetypes.flavor: Horrible visions tormented Jadzia's mind until she reconnected with Joran at the Symbiont Pools. He was a part of her, after all.

action.name: You Are a Part of Me.

crew_archetypes.name: Verad Dax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Verad wanted to be joined so desperately that he could not accept the Commission's refusal and decided to steal Dax from Jadzia.

action.name: I Don't Want Your Advice. I Want To Be Awake.

crew_archetypes.name: Darlene Kursky
crew_archetypes.flavor: Darlene Kursky was a secretary at Incredible Stories. She was fond of science fiction, and Benny’s story delighted her.

crew_archetypes.name: Rejoined Jadzia Dax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Dax meets the wife of a previous host, and faces a difficult choice: give in to feelings or honor taboos.

crew_archetypes.name: Niners Jadzia
crew_archetypes.flavor: Jadzia is upset about having missed a chance to strike out Solok and his Logicians!

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. Soong
crew_archetypes.flavor: A cyberneticist who created the androids Data and Lore, among others.

crew_archetypes.name: Ancient Humanoid
crew_archetypes.flavor: Likely one of the progenitors of many modern humanoid species, the Ancient Humanoid offers a message of peace and hope.

action.name: If You Can See and Hear me, Our Hope has been Fulfilled

crew_archetypes.name: Pirate Tendi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tendi is cast as the savage warrior queen who comes from a long line of Orion Pirates, in the Holonovel “Crisis Point” created by Mariner.

crew_archetypes.name: Tendi and The Dog
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tendi's hand-edited, genetically sequenced Dog may not be quite like Earth dogs, but she's still a good girl with some freakish powers.

action.name: Who Has Malleable Protein Bonds? You Do!

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Tendi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tendi left her pirate days behind to join Starfleet. She brings relentless enthusiasm and friendship to the entire team.

action.name: Did That Full Molecular Engorgement Feel Amazing?!

crew_archetypes.name: Chief Medical Officer Tendi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Battling her conscience while serving as CMO in a drill, Tendi might be more dangerous for her Klingon patient than anything he had planned.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Tendi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tendi is helping repair a satellite when a nebula catches her eye. Unfortunately, it’s at that moment the Cerritos beams away to answer a distress call.

action.name: Wow, Would You Look At That?

crew_archetypes.name: Mistress of the Winter Constellations
crew_archetypes.flavor: Prior to joining Starfleet, Tendi was a member of the Orion Syndicate, where she seems to have developed a fearsome reputation.

action.name: Shut Up And Do Your Job!

crew_archetypes.name: Scorpion Tendi
crew_archetypes.flavor: An enraged Tendi picks up a strange pink cube that turns her into a huge scorpion.

crew_archetypes.name: Ki Mendrossen
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sarek's chief of staff. Together with Perrin, he hid Sarek's illness as long as he could, so that the Legaran conference could still take place.

action.name: I Can Not Delay The Conference

crew_archetypes.name: Writer Jake Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: During the Dominion occupation of Terok Nor, Jake writes articles for the Federation News Service

crew_archetypes.name: Desert Jake Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: “Jake struggles to keep up with his father’s erratic search while tending to his exhausted grandfather.”

crew_archetypes.name: Pah-Wraith Jake Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: Fulfilling an ancient prophecy, Kosst Amojan took over Jake's body and it would have led to disaster if Kai Winn had not driven him out.

crew_archetypes.name: Dahj On The Run
crew_archetypes.flavor: Her life in danger and her world in shambles, Dahj seeks Picard’s help.

action.name: It Was Better When We Were Separate

crew_archetypes.name: Jhet'leya
crew_archetypes.flavor: A crewmate long-presumed-dead who returned to Voyager, pursued by the aliens who revived her.

action.name: There Is A First Time For Everything

crew_archetypes.name: Ilon Tandro
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ilon Tandro came to Deep Space Nine to extradite Jadzia Dax, seeking justice for his father, whom he believed had been betrayed by Curzon Dax.

action.name: This Is Not At All Relevant.

crew_archetypes.name: Doctor Chaotica
crew_archetypes.flavor: Villain of the Captain Proton holonovel, Doctor Chaotica once waged war against photonic lifeforms from subspace.

crew_archetypes.name: Awaiting Amanda Grayson
crew_archetypes.flavor: After pleading with Spock to help his father, Sarek, Amanda anxiously waits for the procedure to be complete.

action.name: Your Duty Is To Your Father

crew_archetypes.name: Graduation Amanda Grayson
crew_archetypes.flavor: As Burnham's adopted mom, she supported her and reminded her to keep her human side.

crew_archetypes.name: Holo-Engineer Zimmerman
crew_archetypes.flavor: Doctor Lewis Zimmerman arrives on Deep Space Nine to use Bashir as the model for his new Long-term Medical Hologram.

action.name: I'm Here To Make You Immortal

crew_archetypes.name: Armed Philippa Georgiou
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain Georgiou to excavate a Crepusculan well that had gone dry and save the species from drought.

action.name: I Thought We Had An Agreement

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Georgiou
crew_archetypes.flavor: Aboard the Discovery, Georgiou adopts the disguise of an Admiral when under inspection by the Earth Defense Force.

action.name: I Had To Make It Believable

crew_archetypes.name: Cabaret Georgiou
crew_archetypes.flavor: Georgiou’s actions during the operation on Qo’noS earn her an invitation into Section 31 while she is laying low in an Orion cabaret.

action.name: I’ll Ask Again--What Do You Want?
This Is An Act Of Mercy

crew_archetypes.name: Rogue Harry Kim
crew_archetypes.flavor: Fifteen years after losing Voyager in an attempt to get home, Harry resolved to alter the past to save the ship.

crew_archetypes.name: Prisoner Kim
crew_archetypes.flavor: Trapped in an Akritirian prison, Kim must resort to desperate measures to survive.

crew_archetypes.name: Fair Haven Harry Kim
crew_archetypes.flavor: Preparing for an evening with Maggie, Harry Kim replicates some flowers and dons a nice suit.

crew_archetypes.name: Alternate Harry Kim
crew_archetypes.flavor: After the original Voyager’s Kim is killed in a battle with the Viidians, an alternate Voyager sends their own Kim to the original ship with Naomi Wildman in hand.

crew_archetypes.name: Caretaker Kim
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kim wakes up in a medical facility with strange sores. He learns he and Torres are ill and could be dangerous to their respective crews.

action.name: The Time For Diplomacy Is Past

crew_archetypes.name: Buckley
crew_archetypes.flavor: The alien protecting Oriana that has been infected by Gorn eggs, which hatch and lead to a violent confrontation.

crew_archetypes.name: Mr. Vup
crew_archetypes.flavor: A bodyguard for Bjayzl, Mr. Vup evaluates and considers the risk of what Rios and Picard offer.

action.name: It Ain't Over Til It's Over

crew_archetypes.name: Mournful Elnor
crew_archetypes.flavor: Elnor grieves for Picard, someone who has played such a vital role in his life.

crew_archetypes.name: Qalankhkai Elnor
crew_archetypes.flavor: After reuniting, Elnor takes up Picard’s lost cause per his Qowat Milat training.

crew_archetypes.name: Displaced Elnor
crew_archetypes.flavor: Transported by Q to an alternate timeline, Elnor finds himself in great danger due to his Romulan heritage.

crew_archetypes.name: Glinn Damar
crew_archetypes.flavor: First seen aboard the freighter Groumall, Damar served as Dukat's second-in-command across multiple assignments.

crew_archetypes.name: Revolutionary Damar
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leader of the Cardassian revolution against the Dominion, Damar was killed by Jem'hadar shortly before the final assault.

crew_archetypes.name: Maab
crew_archetypes.flavor: While playing to both the Klingons and Federation in the mining negotiations, Maab assassinated the current Teer and seized power.

action.name: I Begin To Like You, Earthman...

crew_archetypes.name: Investigator Laris
crew_archetypes.flavor: Accompanying Picard, Laris leverages illegal Romulan technology to investigate Dahj.

action.name: That’s What We Wanted You to Think

crew_archetypes.name: Security Laris
crew_archetypes.flavor: Using her hidden talents, Laris successfully repels the Romulan attack and defends Picard.

crew_archetypes.name: Second Chance Laris
crew_archetypes.flavor: Laris dealt with her complicated feelings for Picard a year and a half after Zhaban’s death.

action.name: We Love Deeply, And Then We Honor That Love By Loving Again

crew_archetypes.name: Shroomies
crew_archetypes.flavor: Highly advanced mysterious species with unknown motives who silently chased and attacked the Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: Sybok
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Vulcan iconoclast, Sybok embraced emotion and sought to find the paradise planet of Sha Ka Ree.

crew_archetypes.name: Wonderland Taylor
crew_archetypes.flavor: Beamed down the rabbit hole, Gillian Taylor is amazed by the transporter technology from the future.

crew_archetypes.name: Lore
crew_archetypes.flavor: Doctor Soong's first Android with a functional positronic brain. Gifted with emotions, he was Data's older 'brother.'

crew_archetypes.name: The One, Lore
crew_archetypes.flavor: After stealing an emotion chip intended for Data, Lore became the leader of a breakaway Borg ship.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Mayweather
crew_archetypes.flavor: Helmsman of the NX-01 Enterprise, Travis Mayweather would explore new worlds alongside Captain Archer.

crew_archetypes.name: Boomer Mayweather
crew_archetypes.flavor: Travis Mayweather was one of the first 'space boomers,' a person born in space.

crew_archetypes.name: Tuskegee Mayweather
crew_archetypes.flavor: Inspired by the holodeck adventures of O'Brien and Bashir, Tuskegee Mayweather was released in the Second Battle of New York event.

action.name: If It's Easy What's The Point?

crew_archetypes.name: Tactical MACO Mayweather
crew_archetypes.flavor: After joining as Archer’s personal bodyguard, Mayweather decides to defy orders from Admiral Forrest in favor of Archer.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Mayweather
crew_archetypes.flavor: On an away mission to study a comet, Mayweather and Reed get up to a little fun with snow.

crew_archetypes.name: Abducted Travis
crew_archetypes.flavor: Travis was found tied to a repair station. It seems he is dead, but there is still a chance to save him.

crew_archetypes.name: Weightlifter Travis
crew_archetypes.flavor: Travis learned long ago the pain of training could help drown out romantic temptation, but there may be more at play here than he realizes.

action.name: Get Them Out Of My Head! The Pain Helps.

crew_archetypes.name: Deral
crew_archetypes.flavor: On Meridian, which shifts between a corporeal and non-corporeal state every sixty years, Deral looks for a way to keep his planet on this plane.

action.name: This Isn't Turning Out Exactly The Way I Planned...
I'm Stuck Here With You Mortals

crew_archetypes.name: Botanist Keiko
crew_archetypes.flavor: A botanist and head of the Enterprise plant biology lab, Keiko later opened a school on Deep Space 9.

crew_archetypes.name: Soren
crew_archetypes.flavor: A member of the androgynous J’naii species who later reveals she identifies as female—is joined by Riker on a rescue mission.

crew_archetypes.name: Princess Thalia and Runa
crew_archetypes.flavor: Princess Thalia will stay behind guarding her little princess Runa. Should King Ridley fall in battle, she will sing an epic song to honor him.

crew_archetypes.name: Valeo Beta V La'an
crew_archetypes.flavor: While on a mission to Valeo Beta V to find survivors, La'an encounters the Gorn again. She has to overcome her anger in order to help the victims.

crew_archetypes.name: Dress Uniform La'an
crew_archetypes.flavor: La’an’s gratitude to Una for saving her life shows as she speaks up on her friend and crewmate’s behalf.

action.name: I Wouldn't Be Alive If It Weren't For Una

crew_archetypes.name: Possessed Felisa Howard
crew_archetypes.flavor: During her lifetime, Felisa had a lover, Ronin, who was an anaphasic creature and who possessed her exhumed corpse.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Tuvok
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ensign on the U.S.S. Excelsior under Captain Sulu, Ensign Tuvok was present for the rescue of James Kirk and Leonard McCoy.

crew_archetypes.name: Security Chief Tuvok
crew_archetypes.flavor: Security Chief for Captain Janeway, and former infiltrator of the Maquis ship Val Jean.

crew_archetypes.name: Maquis Tuvok
crew_archetypes.flavor: On a mission from Starfleet to infiltrate the Maquis, Tuvok joined Chakotay's ship and cell.

crew_archetypes.name: Crashed Tuvok
crew_archetypes.flavor: After crashing on a moon, Tuvok attempts to care for a trio of stranded and frightened children while repairing his shuttle.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Tuvok
crew_archetypes.flavor: In the Mirror Universe, Tuvok was a member of the Terran Rebellion, and used his species’ inherent logic to fight the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance.

action.name: Logic Dictates Caution In The Face Of A Superior Enemy

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Tuvok
crew_archetypes.flavor: A rescued Captain Tuvok showed Seven her final review from Shaw before promoting her to captain.

crew_archetypes.name: Palor Toff
crew_archetypes.flavor: Merchant and collector of rare items. He is so passionate about it that he agreed to get on board to evaluate a unique specimen - Commander Data.

crew_archetypes.name: Lieutenant Saavik
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Vulcan officer assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise, she proved herself in battle with the U.S.S. Reliant.

crew_archetypes.name: Varani
crew_archetypes.flavor: A talented Bajoran musician who dreams of resurrecting the Jaland Forum.

crew_archetypes.name: Alicia Travers
crew_archetypes.flavor: A member of the resistance in New York. Alicia helps Archer liberate her city and restore the 20th century timeline.

crew_archetypes.name: Jenna Mitchell
crew_archetypes.flavor: Jenna Mitchell was assigned to the Enterprise as Operations Officer. Her professionalism and versatility has helped the crew on many occasions.

crew_archetypes.name: "The Colony" Tilly
crew_archetypes.flavor: Seeking help in the repair of their communications equipment, Tilly accompanies Saru on an away mission.

crew_archetypes.name: Party Tilly
crew_archetypes.flavor: Letting loose at a party on Discovery, Tilly enjoys herself while giving Burnham a few pointers and some unsolicited romantic advice.

crew_archetypes.name: Acting Captain Tilly
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tilly’s plan to build a bomb makes for some hard choices as oxygen runs low on Discovery.

crew_archetypes.name: Wonderland Tilly
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tilly knows she has a lot to learn, but she’s determined to become a Captain someday.

action.name: I’m gonna be a captain someday

crew_archetypes.name: Science Officer Tilly
crew_archetypes.flavor: As the Discovery finds its new place in the 32nd century, Tilly finds hers in the role of Science Officer aboard the ship.

crew_archetypes.name: Daring Tilly
crew_archetypes.flavor: Along with Adira, Tilly leads a training mission for cadets. Overcoming the obstacles they face leads Tilly to make an important choice.

action.name: This Is Real. This Is Happening.

crew_archetypes.name: Enterprise Tilly
crew_archetypes.flavor: In a timeline where she remained in the 23rd century, Tilly embraced her curiosity while working her way up to science officer.

crew_archetypes.name: Straal
crew_archetypes.flavor: Exomycologist and researcher aboard the USS Glenn. Discovered the mycelial network with Paul Stamets.

action.name: Right now, we have to finish getting ready.
We Take Our Politics Very Seriously

crew_archetypes.name: Barry Waddle
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Klingon Intelligence Operative disguised as a Human merchant, Barry was trapped on Cardassia Prime during the Klingon-Cardassian War.

crew_archetypes.name: Arne Darvin
crew_archetypes.flavor: A disguised Klingon agent whose plans to poison a grain shipment were foiled by Kirk and some furballs.

crew_archetypes.name: Kashyk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Inspector Kashyk believed telepaths were dangerous so he became romantically involved with Janeway to suss them out on the Federation ship.

action.name: Trust Has To Be Earned. It's Gradual.
I Did What I Had To

crew_archetypes.name: Carlos Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: Lieutenant Data takes on the role of Carlos in one of Picard’s Dixon Hill holonovels.

crew_archetypes.name: Nemesis Sacrifice Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: He sacrifices himself to save Captain Picard and the crew of the USS Enterprise-E in the battle against Praetor Shinzon.

crew_archetypes.name: Musketeer Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: A holographic musketeer appears with Data’s visage to combat Barclay.

crew_archetypes.name: Dealer Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: Data's mastery of statistics and probability means he should beat any player in Starfleet. If only he could read their faces.

action.name: Is That What Is Known As A Poker Face?

crew_archetypes.name: Professor Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: In this alternate future, Data holds the Lucasian Chair of mathematics at Cambridge University.

action.name: We Will Get To The Bottom Of This

crew_archetypes.name: Hollow Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: Data’s encounter with Tam Elbrun and Gomtuu teaches him about the human desire to belong somewhere.

crew_archetypes.name: Data and Spot
crew_archetypes.flavor: Data loves his cat Spot so much, he even wrote an “Ode to Spot”!

action.name: Oh, Spot, The Complex Levels of Behavior You Display!

crew_archetypes.name: First Officer Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: Data rises up to First Officer as a replacement for Riker after a rather uptight captain took over the Enterprise in Picard’s absence.

crew_archetypes.name: Dress Uniform Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: In honor of Riker's and Deanna's “conjugation” Data took the stage and gave a performance that blew everybody away.

action.name: Oh, Blue Skies, Smiling at Meeee

crew_archetypes.name: Phantasms Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: Data's dream system malfunctions and he becomes a prisoner of repeating and worsening nightmares.

action.name: Have You Ever Had A Nightmare?

crew_archetypes.name: Bridge Officer Data
crew_archetypes.flavor: Data reclaims his seat on the Enterprise-D bridge, but could something grander be in store for the fleet's first acting android captain?

crew_archetypes.name: Data as Masaka
crew_archetypes.flavor: After happening upon a comet, Data begins taking on the personality of an entity calling itself Masaka.

crew_archetypes.name: Chief Engineer Hemmer
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hemmer is the Chief Engineer of the USS Enterprise under Captain Pike. He will not fight for Starfleet, but he will defend its ideals.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Hemmer
crew_archetypes.flavor: Trapped in the cargo bay with Uhura, Hemmer dispenses wisdom while trying to dispose of the damaged core.

action.name: I Commend You To The Cosmos

crew_archetypes.name: Valeo Beta V Hemmer
crew_archetypes.flavor: As a result of his encounter with the Gorn, Hemmer made the only choice to protect those he loved.

crew_archetypes.name: Wizard Hemmer
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hemmer's telepathic abilities allowed him to confront and contact the consciousness from the Ionian Nebula to resolve the situation.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Pollard
crew_archetypes.flavor: After traveling to the 32nd century with the rest of the U.S.S. Discovery crew, Dr. Pollard continues her mission to save lives.

crew_archetypes.name: Balok
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the Fesarius, Balok manned his advanced ship alone. He used a puppet to intimidate and deceive potential threats due to his diminutive appearance.

crew_archetypes.name: The Hansens
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hansens carried out the first ever research mission to study the Borg that unfortunately came to a disastrous end.

crew_archetypes.name: Sutra
crew_archetypes.flavor: After gaining access to the 'Admonition' via mind meld with Jurati, she convinced her kin to call the ancient Synth beings for protection.

crew_archetypes.name: Insubordinate Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: Mariner only sees the rules as suggestions, most of which she doesn’t follow.

crew_archetypes.name: Bat'leth Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: Overindulging on Romulan ale, Mariner gets carried away with a bat’leth.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: Beckett Mariner is a command ensign on the USS Cerritos. She breaks dumb rules that shouldn’t be there so she can do a better job!

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: Mariner breaks protocol by using magnetic boots a little too often, which explains why the Cerritos forgot her on a satellite in space.

crew_archetypes.name: Vindicta Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the Vinpocalypse, marauder Vindicta is determined to take down Captain Freeman at any cost--preferably on a rickety catwalk.

crew_archetypes.name: Deep Space Nine Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: From blackmailing Quark to breaking Worf’s mek'leth, what other adventures did Mariner have aboard Deep Space Nine?

action.name: Man! It’s Like a New Thing Every Week With Those Guys!

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: During a training drill, Mariner must take the place of her mirror universe counterpart. Unfortunately, Mariner is outed by Mirror Boimler.

action.name: Seriously, Why Is This Drill Still Going?!

crew_archetypes.name: Wanted Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: During the drill, Mariner tries on the role of the wanted captain of the three-man away group.

crew_archetypes.name: Rock'n'Roll Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: Mariner played a heavy metal song so inspired and loud that even a nearby Klingon ship could appreciate it.

crew_archetypes.name: Exoarchaeologist Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: In an attempt to find herself, Mariner is transferred to the Independent Archaeologist Guilds. However, despite her adventures to save the Golden Idol, she realizes that she misses Starfleet.

action.name: How Many Old Brown Pots Do We Really Need?

crew_archetypes.name: Displaced Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: Mariner and Boimler end up on the 23rd century Enterprise. While Pike looks for ways to send them home, Mariner studies the people around her with interest.

action.name: Look, It Was All Me, Okay?

crew_archetypes.name: Aged Mariner
crew_archetypes.flavor: What is happening, and why does Mariner get older and older as she approaches the pergium? Is this some kind of joke?

crew_archetypes.name: Wyatt Miller
crew_archetypes.flavor: Cancelling his wedding with Deanna, Wyatt joins the Tarellians in the hopes of helping them find a cure to the virus that has nearly wiped out their civilization.

action.name: What I Want Is To Cure People

crew_archetypes.name: Arissa
crew_archetypes.flavor: Odo's mysterious lover turns out to be a net-girl who is being hunted and is in mortal danger.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. T'Ana
crew_archetypes.flavor: The CMO of USS Cerritos. She has a dry wit and terse bedside manner, but is a trusted doctor to the crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Bankrobber T'Ana
crew_archetypes.flavor: T'Ana and Shaxs roleplay bank robbers in the vein of Bonnie and Clyde in the holodeck, where they get into a shootout.

action.name: Hands Up Where I Can See Them!

crew_archetypes.name: T'Ana in the Box
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tendi learns something everyone who interacts with felines is bound to learn - no matter how valuable what’s inside the box is, the box itself is the true prize.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. JG Sam Lavelle
crew_archetypes.flavor: A career-oriented and driven officer, Lavelle was highly motivated to take steps to realize what he wants: a promotion.

crew_archetypes.name: Goodgey
crew_archetypes.flavor: Goodgey is a part separated from Badgey, containing all the positive qualities that were originally incorporated into the system.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Detmer
crew_archetypes.flavor: With a promotion and a new implant, Detmer is ready to face the trials and adventures the future holds for her.

crew_archetypes.name: Away Team Detmer
crew_archetypes.flavor: Detmer takes part in an away mission to a dead planet to stop its destruction.

action.name: There's No Reason I Should Be Fine

crew_archetypes.name: T'Mir
crew_archetypes.flavor: Part of a Vulcan science vessel that crashed on Earth, T'Mir assumed command of the survivors.

crew_archetypes.name: Lon Suder
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Betazoid member of the Maquis, Suder successfully channeled his violent tendencies to help retake Voyager from the Kazon.

crew_archetypes.name: Pregnant Eleen
crew_archetypes.flavor: The mother of the future heir, miraculously saved from execution. As regent, her first priority was to improve her people's relationship with the Federation.

action.name: I Was Proud To Obey The Laws

crew_archetypes.name: President T'Rina
crew_archetypes.flavor: As the president of Ni'Var, T'Rina must find a way to preserve the reunification of Vulcans and Romulans as she considers rejoining the Federation.

crew_archetypes.name: Investigator Odo
crew_archetypes.flavor: Odo was pressed into service by the Cardassians during the Occupation of Bajor.

crew_archetypes.name: Constable Odo
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief of Security on Deep Space Nine, Odo was a constant presence onboard the station.

crew_archetypes.name: Trader Odo
crew_archetypes.flavor: Disguised as a trader, Odo joined the Defiant crew in preventing the assassination of Captain Kirk by a time-traveling Klingon.

crew_archetypes.name: Umpire Odo
crew_archetypes.flavor: As an impartial observer, Odo was asked to be the umpire for a baseball game between the Niners and the Logicians.

crew_archetypes.name: Stranded Odo
crew_archetypes.flavor: Stranded after a runabout crash, Odo and Quark were forced to cooperate to survive.

crew_archetypes.name: Bagman Odo
crew_archetypes.flavor: Together with Nog, Odo steals the money from the safe in the count room of Frankie's casino.

crew_archetypes.name: Kodrak
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kodrak is the Klingon alias of Odo. In the guise of Kodrak, he had the opportunity to get closer to the Founder and expose him.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Shaxs
