crew_archetypes.flavor: Lieutenant Shaxs is ready and willing to solve any issue with direct confrontation. Let’s consider ourselves lucky he is on our side.

crew_archetypes.name: Heroic Shaxs
crew_archetypes.flavor: When the entire crew was in danger from the Pakled onslaught, Shaxs sacrificed himself to save the others.

crew_archetypes.name: Bankrobber Shaxs
crew_archetypes.flavor: Shaxs and T'Ana  roleplay bank robbers in the vein of Bonnie and Clyde in the holodeck, where they get into a shootout.

action.name: Everybody Down! This Is A Robbery!

crew_archetypes.name: Kahless the Unforgettable
crew_archetypes.flavor: Cloned in labs in the Boreth monastery, Kahless was the rightful heir to the crown of the Klingon Empire.

crew_archetypes.name: Nancy Hedford
crew_archetypes.flavor: Originally sent to stop a war, Nancy instead found herself an unwitting player in an unrequited love story between a non-corporeal entity and a human, a story which put her very life at stake.

crew_archetypes.name: Orion Dealer
crew_archetypes.flavor: The sociable Orion, who suggested Tilly to inhale volcanic vapors, actually turns out to be Georgiou's accomplice.

action.name: Volcanic Vapor, Straight From The Source

crew_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Cabot Janitor
crew_archetypes.flavor: An officer aboard the U.S.S Cabot was given the unfortunate task of cleaning up Larkin’s modified Tribbles.

action.name: You Are Starting To Annoy Me

crew_archetypes.name: Lieutenant Commander Saru
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief Science Officer of the U.S.S. Shenzhou.

action.name: I Saw Hope In The Stars
The Light, It Is Almost Like Music

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Saru
crew_archetypes.flavor: As a slave, the previously unnamed Kelpien attends to Captain Burnham.

crew_archetypes.name: Human Saru
crew_archetypes.flavor: A malfunctioning holoprogram aboard the wreckage of the KSF Khi'eth made Saru appear human.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Saru
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain Saru consults his first officer Tilly for recommendations on pithy catchphrases.

crew_archetypes.name: Returning Saru
crew_archetypes.flavor: Saru leaves Kaminar and turns down a position as captain to offer Discovery his insight and support.

crew_archetypes.name: Elder Saru
crew_archetypes.flavor: On Kaminar, Saru helps his people ensure that Su’Kal is not a threat, and is also encouraged to share his knowledge with the rest of the world.

action.name: We Live Now, Together, In Communion

crew_archetypes.name: Ambassador Saru
crew_archetypes.flavor: Though an ambassador, Saru can't leave the action side of Starfleet completely - thus he takes part in a mission to stop Tahal.

action.name: We Can Face That Struggle Together

crew_archetypes.name: Wesley Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: A young member of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D's crew, which he would later join as an Ensign.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: After passing the Starfleet Entrance Examination, Wesley Crusher was promoted to a full Ensign.

crew_archetypes.name: Acting Ensign Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: After befriending and assisting The Traveler, Wesley Crusher was field promoted to Acting Ensign.

crew_archetypes.name: Formal Dress Wesley Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: Wesley returned from his journey with the Traveller and attended the Troi-Riker wedding in 2379.

crew_archetypes.name: Cadet Wesley Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: Wesley Crusher was a Starfleet cadet for three years before leaving with The Traveler.

crew_archetypes.name: Little Boy Blue Wesley
crew_archetypes.flavor: A period-dressed holoprogram of Wesley Crusher enjoying a picnic with his mother before a fight breaks out.

crew_archetypes.name: Experienced Traveler Wesley
crew_archetypes.flavor: Having met Kore, Wesley offers her a choice - to stay where she is or become a Traveler like him.

action.name: So The Universe Is Essentially A Grand Tapestry

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror 'Smiley' O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leader of the Terran Rebellion, 'Smiley' O'Brien commanded the I.S.S. Defiant against the KCA.

crew_archetypes.name: Chief O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: Older and wiser, Miles O'Brien would go on to finish his career as a Professor of Engineering.

crew_archetypes.name: Undercover O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: Working undercover for Starfleet Intelligence, O'Brien was ordered to investigate the Orion Syndicate.

crew_archetypes.name: RAF Miles O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: O'Brien and Bashir often enjoyed a holorecreation of the Battle of Britain campaign.

crew_archetypes.name: Falcon O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: After a transporter accident, O'brien's image is used by Dr. Bashir's holosuite program to display an assassin.

crew_archetypes.name: Kal'Hyah O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tormented through the Klingon ritual of kal’Hyah, O’Brien’s patience is pushed to its limit.

crew_archetypes.name: Scapegoat O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: Together with Yates, O’Brien puts up an act to distract the guard and let Nog slip into the count room of Frankie’s casino.

crew_archetypes.name: Racquetball O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief O'Brien is strongly determined to beat Doctor Bashir at racquetball.

action.name: I Can Play Any Style You Like

crew_archetypes.name: Hippie O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: Trying to find Sisko, O’Brien, along with Kira, ends up in the late 1960s, encountering a pair of hippies.

action.name: I Think I Know What Happened

crew_archetypes.name: O'Brien at the Conn
crew_archetypes.flavor: O'Brien takes the conn of the Enterprise-D after Lieutenant Torres is frozen by Q.

crew_archetypes.name: Wedding Groom O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: One thing O’Brien knows for sure is that he loves Keiko and will do anything to marry her.

crew_archetypes.name: Tobin O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: A brilliant engineer. In his time, Tobin was known for his original approach to Fermat's Last Theorem. Maybe some of his originality rubbed off on Jadzia after all.

action.name: I Guess I'm a Little Nervous.

crew_archetypes.name: Albert Macklin
crew_archetypes.flavor: Writer at Incredible Tales who loves to write about robots more than people.

crew_archetypes.name: Paranoid O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: O’Brien was replaced with a clone to derail the peace talks. However, the clone, for some unknown reason at first, tried to save the day.

crew_archetypes.name: Ux-Mal O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: O'Brien was overtaken by one of the criminal entities from Ux-Mal, as were Troi and Data, hoping to escape imprisonment. However the entities were forced to retreat.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Mitchell
crew_archetypes.flavor: After a brief direct contact with negative energy, Gary Mitchell began to display a widening array of godlike abilities.

crew_archetypes.name: Yarnek
crew_archetypes.flavor: Yarnek forced Enterprise crew into a battle of 'good' vs. 'evil' for the edification of the Excalbian people.

crew_archetypes.name: Lara
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chosen for the mission to discover the stolen Soul of the Skorr, Lara was a hunter who was well-known for her flawless directional sense.

crew_archetypes.name: Primal Peanut Hamper
crew_archetypes.flavor: Refusing to carry out a dangerous mission, exocomp Hamper abandoned the ship, after which she became stuck in deep space and then crash-landed on Areolus.

action.name: I Didn't Want To Sound Robotic

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Peanut Hamper
crew_archetypes.flavor: There is a new ensign on board USS Cerritos, and it seems that Peanut Humper can compete with Mariner in harmfulness and waywardness.

action.name: I Joined Starfleet To Piss Off My Dad

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the Terran Empire's I.S.S Enterprise, Kirk's use of the Tantalus Device allowed him to eliminate rivals.

crew_archetypes.name: Kal-if-fee Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chosen as champion by Spock's betrothed, T'Pring, Kirk is forced to fight his friend to the 'death'.

crew_archetypes.name: Romulan Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kirk masqueraded as a Romulan in order to steal a cloaking device for Starfleet to study.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: After the conclusion of his five-year mission, Kirk was promoted to the rank of rear admiral.

crew_archetypes.name: Rura Penthe Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Convicted of the murder of Chancellor Gorkon, Kirk was sent to Rura Penthe, the 'Alien's Graveyard'.

action.name: Plans To The McKinley Rocket Base
How Are The Stone Knives And Bearskins?

crew_archetypes.name: Tribble Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kirk realizes the magnitude of the tribble problem, and orders all tribbles removed from the Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: Anxious Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: A concerned Kirk relays Spock details to help him remember.

crew_archetypes.name: Judoka Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sometimes Captain Kirk uses judo techniques, for example, in self-defense or to get along with someone.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: While exploring the distressed Defiant, Kirk gets trapped in interspace. The only thing keeping him alive is his environmental suit.

crew_archetypes.name: Chances Taken Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kirk is determined to risk his life in order to stop the Doomsday Machine.

action.name: A Chance I'll Have To Take

crew_archetypes.name: Officiant Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kirk was officiating a wedding when the ship went to red alert. The marriage that should have just begun would instead end in tragedy.

action.name: All Captains Have One Happy Privilege - Uniting Two People

crew_archetypes.name: Farragut Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: In an alternate timeline where Kirk was the captain of the USS Farragut, he and Pike save Outpost 4 from Romulan attack - at great cost.

action.name: Quite The Ship You Got Here

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: To become an ensign, you have to love Starfleet. To become a legend, you need to be James Kirk.

action.name: Not The Worst Way To Go

crew_archetypes.name: James T. Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: His sense of duty is strong, but Kirk never loses his sense of wonder and awe for the universe.

action.name: The Only Thing That's Truly Yours Is The Rest Of Humanity

crew_archetypes.name: 21st Century Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Seeing Kirk in 21st century Toronto makes one wonder, could Federation time travelers already be in our time, posing as cosplayers?

crew_archetypes.name: Technician Rom
crew_archetypes.flavor: Younger brother of Quark, Rom found success in Deep Space Nine's Engineering crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Grand Nagus Rom
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leading reform among the Ferengi, Rom was eventually elevated to the rank of Grand Nagus.

crew_archetypes.name: Niners Rom
crew_archetypes.flavor: Rom joined Sisko's baseball team, pinch hitting for the Niners against the Vulcan Logicians.

crew_archetypes.name: Brother Rom
crew_archetypes.flavor: Quark’s younger brother, who has worked for several years in his bar.

crew_archetypes.name: Innovator Rom
crew_archetypes.flavor: Grand Nagus Rom proves looks can be deceiving, leaving those who negotiate with him to wonder who's really in charge.

crew_archetypes.name: General K'Vagh
crew_archetypes.flavor: K'Vagh oversaw the Klingon Augmentation program, but when this led to the spread of the virus, he kidnapped Phlox to stop the disease.

action.name: I Suggest You Stop Asking Questions

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Ransom
crew_archetypes.flavor: Jack Ransom is the USS Cerritos’ first officer under Captain Freeman. He has broad shoulders, shiny hair, and… where was I going with this?

crew_archetypes.name: Power Ransom
crew_archetypes.flavor: During a mission to Apergos, Ransom absorbs a strange energy that gives him great strength and power, but at the same time exposes all his weaknesses.

action.name: I Will Create a Race of Ransomites!

crew_archetypes.name: CMO Pulaski
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief Medical Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D in 2365, she also served on the U.S.S. Repulse.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Angel
crew_archetypes.flavor: The deceptive captain of the Serene Squall. Angel posed as Doctor Aspen to gain access to the Enterprise and the trust of the crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Senator Cretak
crew_archetypes.flavor: Romulan senator and representative on Deep Space 9, Cretak was the victim of a Section 31 plot keep her from power.

crew_archetypes.name: Disguised Daniels
crew_archetypes.flavor: Posing as a steward, Daniels blended in with the USS Enterprise crew in order to capture Silik.

action.name: I Think My Bunkmate Majored In Chaos Theory

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Scott
crew_archetypes.flavor: An ingenious engineer of Scottish descent who never failed to pull Captain Kirk and the U.S.S. Enterprise out of danger.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Scott
crew_archetypes.flavor: Trapped in a transporter buffer for 75 years, Captain Scott was later rescued by the U.S.S. Enterprise-D.

crew_archetypes.name: Professor Scott
crew_archetypes.flavor: Posing as 'Professor' Scott, he helped build a tank to transport humpback whales to the 23rd century.

crew_archetypes.name: Demo Man Scotty
crew_archetypes.flavor: After rigging a delay detonation device, Scotty is about to beam back to the Enterprise, leaving Kirk face-to-face with the Doomsday Machine.

action.name: Once It's Activated, There's No Way To Stop It

crew_archetypes.name: Chief Engineer Scott
crew_archetypes.flavor: While the crew exposed the Khitomer plot, Scotty saved the Federation president by shooting Colonel West.

crew_archetypes.name: Scuba Scotty
crew_archetypes.flavor: Scott has only one way to save Kirk and Spock from the sur-snake - dive into the water and look for them himself.

action.name: We've Lost Contact, Captain. Repeat, We've Lost Contact.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. JG Scott
crew_archetypes.flavor: Even in a disaster, Montgomery Scott shows his engineering ingenuity by attempting to first divert the Gorn, then entrap them.

action.name: Where Are My Manners, Eh? Montgomery Scott At Your Service

crew_archetypes.name: Queen Paolana
crew_archetypes.flavor: Paolana was ready for any tricks to fix her son and force him to take the throne.

action.name: A Meager Price To Pay To Get You On The Throne

crew_archetypes.name: Omet'iklan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Fierce and true to his principles, Omet'iklan joined the crew of the USS Defiant after his ship was destroyed.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Kelby
crew_archetypes.flavor: An engineering officer aboard the NX-01 Enterprise, Kelby briefly held the position of Chief Engineer.

crew_archetypes.name: Tevrin Krit
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captaining the D-756, Krit happily attempted to claim the bounty against the scoundrel who had stolen from him - Harcourt Mudd.

action.name: You Don't Trust Me, Do You?

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander MacDougal
crew_archetypes.flavor: Lt. Commander MacDougal rushes to restore control of the ship after the Polywater Virus wreaks havoc on its crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Carol Freeman
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the Cerritos, Freeman has a flair for the dramatic, extensive second contact experience, and no time for Mariner’s shenanigans.

crew_archetypes.name: Minooki Freeman
crew_archetypes.flavor: Any hopes for a normal day on the Cerritos are dashed when Captain Freeman is possessed by the mask of Minooki.

crew_archetypes.name: One
crew_archetypes.flavor: A fusion of Seven's nanoprobes with the Doctor's mobile emitter, was in effect a 29th century Borg.

crew_archetypes.name: Outpost Vina
crew_archetypes.flavor: The sole survivor of a survey ship crash on Talos IV, Vina helps the Keeper lure Pike into the Menagerie.

crew_archetypes.name: Hain
crew_archetypes.flavor: A former accomplice of Morn’s who comes looking for the latinum he was cheated out of following a heist years ago.

action.name: A Thousand Bricks of Gold-Pressed Latinum

crew_archetypes.name: Charlene
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Doctor’s holographic wife with whom he explored what it might be like to be a working father.

action.name: Line Up Next To The Door, Children

crew_archetypes.name: KDF Gowron
crew_archetypes.flavor: Gowron, son of M'Rel, was one of the final two challengers to succeed K'Mpec as the Klingon Chancellor.

crew_archetypes.name: Chancellor Gowron
crew_archetypes.flavor: Gowron solidified his postion of Klingon Chancellor by defeating the Duras-led faction of a civil war.

crew_archetypes.name: Ariana
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ariana was a literal dream come true for Wyatt Miller, who had visions and dreams of her since childhood.

action.name: And I Knew You Would Be This Brave

crew_archetypes.name: Orion Captain
crew_archetypes.flavor: Under the guise of returning a strobolin stolen from the USS Huron, the Captain is planning something far more dangerous.

action.name: Surrender Your Cargo Or Be Destroyed

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Mark Jameson
crew_archetypes.flavor: Time caught up with Admiral Jameson as he confronted Karnas while negotiating a hostage situation.

action.name: I'm Strong, I'm Alert, I'm Fit!

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Raffaela Musiker
crew_archetypes.flavor: “Lt. Commander Raffi’s determination to see the Romulan evacuation through ultimately cost her her post.”

crew_archetypes.name: Reunion Raffi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Raffi attempts to reconcile with her son, Gabriel, in the hopes of making up for lost time.

crew_archetypes.name: 2024 Raffi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Together with Seven and Rios, Raffi was sent back to 2024 Los Angeles to find the mysterious Watcher, the key to fixing the future.

crew_archetypes.name: Lady Sirella
crew_archetypes.flavor: Mistress of the House Of Martok, Lady Sirella must approve of anyone who wishes to join the house through marriage.

crew_archetypes.name: Subcommander T'Pol
crew_archetypes.flavor: Assigned to the Enterprise in the 22nd century, T'Pol was essential to many of the Enterprise's missions.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander T'Pol
crew_archetypes.flavor: Promoted to the rank of Commander after joining Starfleet in 2154.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror T'Pol
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Vulcan slave of the Terran Empire, T'Pol joins with other nonhumans in a revolt.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain T'Pol
crew_archetypes.flavor: When Archer was infected by temporal parasites, T'Pol took command of the Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit T'Pol
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sub-commander T’Pol boards a dangerous Klingon ship as it descends into the depths of a gas giant.

crew_archetypes.name: Pernaia Prime T'Pol
crew_archetypes.flavor: Accompanied by Archer and Travis Mayweather, T’Pol heads to Pernaia Prime to hunt down the Vulcan fugitive, Menos.

crew_archetypes.name: Carpenter Street T'Pol
crew_archetypes.flavor: Along with Archer, T'Pol goes back to 21st century Detroit to stop the Xindi-Reptilians.

crew_archetypes.name: Meditative T'Pol
crew_archetypes.flavor: T’Pol teaches Trip various neuro-pressure techniques to help with his stress and insomnia.

action.name: The Risk of Paralysis is Minimal

crew_archetypes.name: Suus Mahna T'Pol
crew_archetypes.flavor: First, T'Pol teaches the colonists the skills of Vulcan martial arts, and then demonstrates these skills in practice, disarming one of the attacking Klingons.

action.name: Try To Strike Me. You Won't Hurt Me.

crew_archetypes.name: Phoenix Cochrane
crew_archetypes.flavor: Developer of the first human warp drive, Zefram Cochrane was the target of a Borg attack in 2063.

crew_archetypes.name: Doctor Cochrane
crew_archetypes.flavor: A brilliant scientist, the words Doctor Cochrane left behind were a beacon for United Earth’s future.

action.name: It Will Let Us Boldly Go

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Marlena Moreau
crew_archetypes.flavor: It took little time to realize that Kirk was from a different universe. But sending him back wasn’t easy.

crew_archetypes.name: Dysek
crew_archetypes.flavor: Dysek is a talented physician, but part of a system that allocates care not by need, but by assumed importance. However, he supported the Doctor in his desire to change the system.

crew_archetypes.name: Toreth
crew_archetypes.flavor: Toreth’s long-standing distrust of the Tal Shiar raises the stakes on an intense mission to smuggle defectors to the Federation without her knowledge.

crew_archetypes.name: Remy
crew_archetypes.flavor: While in command of the Serene Squall, Remy and his crew were able to capture Pike and the others, though not for long.

crew_archetypes.name: Tekeny Ghemor
crew_archetypes.flavor: A legate in the Cardassian Central Command. Ghemor is secretly involved in the Cardassian Dissident movement and is willing to risk his cover to protect Kira.

action.name: I Won't Let Them Hurt You
You Have to Let Me Go

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Doctor Culber
crew_archetypes.flavor: A high-ranking physician in the Terran Empire who supported Lorca and Burnham’s attempt to usurp the throne.

crew_archetypes.name: Bajoran Culber
crew_archetypes.flavor: A malfunctioning holoprogram aboard the wreckage of the KSF Khi'eth made Culber appear Bajoran.

crew_archetypes.name: Confidant Culber
crew_archetypes.flavor: CMO and a shoulder to lean on for the Discovery crew, who does not leave scientific research to help Gray.

crew_archetypes.name: D'Erika Tendi
crew_archetypes.flavor: D'Erika stages her own kidnapping on the eve of her wedding with one goal - to return her sister D'Vana to the Syndicate.

action.name: Wow, Did Starfleet Teach You Those Amazing Detective Skills?

crew_archetypes.name: Resistance Rhys
crew_archetypes.flavor: After escaping from Emerald Chain Regulators, Rhys and the crew of the Discovery help to take back the ship.

crew_archetypes.name: CMO Bashir
crew_archetypes.flavor: Second in his class at Starfleet Medical, Bashir chose to do 'frontier medicine' at Deep Space Nine.

crew_archetypes.name: Bashir, Julian Bashir
crew_archetypes.flavor: Bashir played the role of a secret agent in a recreational holosuite program.

crew_archetypes.name: Changeling Bashir
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Changeling infiltrator replaced Bashir and attempted to destroy the Bajoran sun.

crew_archetypes.name: RAF Julian Bashir
crew_archetypes.flavor: Bashir and O'Brien often enjoyed a holorecreation of the Battle of Britain campaign.

action.name: This Is Where Heroes Are Made
I'm a Doctor, Not a Historian

crew_archetypes.name: Heist Bashir
crew_archetypes.flavor: Bashir doctors the guard’s drink with ipecac to allow the heist to be successful.

action.name: And I slip Ipecac into Howard’s Drink

crew_archetypes.name: Risa Bashir
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leeta and Bashir perform the Bajoran Rite of Separation while on Risa.

crew_archetypes.name: Kal'Hyah Bashir
crew_archetypes.flavor: A participant in the Klingon ritual of kal’Hyah, Bashir’s endurance is tested through the trials of deprivation, blood, pain, sacrifice, anguish and death.

crew_archetypes.name: Julius Eaton
crew_archetypes.flavor: Working for Incredible Tales magazine Julius Eaton wrote about the future and the technologies it might bring.

crew_archetypes.name: Torias Bashir
crew_archetypes.flavor: Bashir had no problems with sharing his body for the zhian'tara ritual. But he won't be happy when he finds out what Torias did with it.

action.name: Life Is Too Short To Deprive Yourself Of The Simple Pleasures

crew_archetypes.name: Assimilated Bashir
crew_archetypes.flavor: Bashir was assimilated… Is it a terrible reality or just a bad joke? Who knows.

action.name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Borg Drone. Oh, wait...

crew_archetypes.name: Borg Queen
crew_archetypes.flavor: Originally a member of Borg-designated Species 125, the Borg Queen brought order to the chaos of the hive mind.

crew_archetypes.name: La Sirena Borg Queen
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Borg Queen opts for cunning over brute force in her attempts to control Jurati.

action.name: Betrayal Is An Anagram For “Believe Me”

crew_archetypes.name: Ubiquitous Borg Queen
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Borg Queen is everywhere, making her cruelest assimilation yet - the youth of the Federation and the son of Locutus.

action.name: Take Everything Back From Those Who Live Like Shattered Glass.

crew_archetypes.name: Unimatrix Zero Borg Queen
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Borg Queen discovers that some of the drones are ‘malfunctioning’ and intends to invade Unimatrix Zero to destroy it.

action.name: Stay Away From Things That Don't Concern You

crew_archetypes.name: Sidney La Forge
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sidney “Crash” La Forge mirrors her father’s kindness, loyalty and determination, which she displays when all seems lost aboard the Titan-A.

crew_archetypes.name: Assimilated Sidney La Forge
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sidney La Forge, like everyone else 25 and under, is assimilated by the Borg through a signal that activates DNA placed in her body by the transporter.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Jennifer Sh'reyan
crew_archetypes.flavor: A former member of The Red Shirts Jen aspires to become a captain one day. In the meantime she ignores Mariner and focuses on pottery and yoga.

action.name: Pff...I Don't Think About You At All

crew_archetypes.name: Seven in Blue
crew_archetypes.flavor: After being severed from the Borg Collective, Seven of Nine--now called Seven--struggled to adapt.

crew_archetypes.name: Temporal Agent Seven
crew_archetypes.flavor: A crew member on the timeship Relativity, she was later replaced by Seven of Nine.

crew_archetypes.name: Seven of Nine
crew_archetypes.flavor: Despite her past, Seven of Nine proved to be a fearless officer willing to defend the U.S.S. Voyager to the death.

crew_archetypes.name: Drone Seven of Nine
crew_archetypes.flavor: When Annika Hansen was assimilated with her family, she became the Borg drone Seven of Nine.

action.name: Hunt It Down And Kill It

crew_archetypes.name: Indulgent Seven
crew_archetypes.flavor: In an effort to conceal the Doctor from the Lokirrim, Seven downloads his program into her cybernetic matrix.

action.name: There Won't Be A Next Time
I Didn't Want to Disillusion Him

crew_archetypes.name: Borg Queen Seven
crew_archetypes.flavor: Seven of Nine goes to extreme measures to protect Picard and Soji by becoming The Artifact’s queen.

crew_archetypes.name: Seven In Command
crew_archetypes.flavor: Thanks to her knowledge of the Borg, Seven takes the captain's chair of the Stargazer and leads the field mission.

crew_archetypes.name: Seven, Son of K'Vok
crew_archetypes.flavor: Seven manifests the personalities of assimilated individuals. One of them - the Klingon son of K’vok - emerges as she works with Torres.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Kor
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kor, son of Rynar, commanded the force occupying Organia. His conflict with Kirk helped establish the Organian peace treaty.

crew_archetypes.name: Shinzon
crew_archetypes.flavor: A clone of Jean-Luc Picard, Shinzon captained the mighty Scimitar warship against the U.S.S. Enterprise-E.

crew_archetypes.name: Subcommander T'Rul
crew_archetypes.flavor: As part of a Federation-Romulan treaty, T'Rul was posted to the Defiant to operate the cloaking device.

crew_archetypes.name: Skorr Tchar
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Crown Prince of the Skorr. Determined to return his race to their warrior roots, he’ll do whatever it takes.

action.name: A Noble Death to Win a Great Dream

crew_archetypes.name: Jaglom Shrek
crew_archetypes.flavor: An Yridian information dealer who sold Worf the false hope that his father was still alive.

crew_archetypes.name: Quarren of the Kyrian
crew_archetypes.flavor: Quarren was able to reexamine everything he knew about Voyager and his discoveries lead to an understanding between the Kyrians and Vaskans.

action.name: Trying to get home, to Mars

crew_archetypes.name: Ardra
crew_archetypes.flavor: A legendary devil-figure on Ventax II, a con artist impersonated her in order to take control of the planet.

crew_archetypes.name: Trajok
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Humanoid wrestler. During his time on Deep Space 9, he trained Dax in the Galeo-Manada technique.

crew_archetypes.name: Doctor Vellek
crew_archetypes.flavor: An outstanding scientist of his time. His worst fears were realized when his notes on the Progenitors fell into the wrong hands.

action.name: This Power Cannot Fall Into The Wrong Hands

crew_archetypes.name: Ryn
crew_archetypes.flavor: Though Ryn is forced to implant explosives in his fellow slaves’ necks, he looks out for them and wants to overthrow Osyraa.

action.name: Who's Ready To Get Out Of Here?

crew_archetypes.name: Flint
crew_archetypes.flavor: Six thousand years and several aliases have brought Flint several lifetimes’ worth of experience - and ambition.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. Carol Marcus
crew_archetypes.flavor: Principal scientist on Project Genesis, Doctor Marcus pursued a dream of bringing life from lifelessness.

action.name: Into The Heart Of The Nova

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Robert April
crew_archetypes.flavor: Despite moving up to the position of admiral, April still finds himself tethered to the Enterprise and the (mis)adventures of her crew.

action.name: This Bridge Is More Like Home Than Anywhere Else

crew_archetypes.name: Nanclus
crew_archetypes.flavor: Nanclus was the Romulan ambassador. He was part of a conspiracy against peace negotiations between the Federation and the Klingon Empire.

action.name: I Don't Know What To Believe

crew_archetypes.name: Expedition Vash
crew_archetypes.flavor: A student of archaeology infamous for her ethically questionable practices.

crew_archetypes.name: Profiteer Vash
crew_archetypes.flavor: Vash looks to make a quick profit by partnering with Quark to hold an auction on Deep Space Nine.

crew_archetypes.name: Holiday Vash
crew_archetypes.flavor: Vash met Picard on Risa and fell in love with him. However, this did not stop her from using him for her own purposes.

action.name: You Look Like a Man Who Could Handle Trouble

crew_archetypes.name: Dolorex
crew_archetypes.flavor: This buzzkill Betazoid spy was intent to use her Betazoid telepathy to obtain the intelligence she so desperately sought.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Sulu
crew_archetypes.flavor: Science Officer on the U.S.S. Enterprise, he would later rise to the rank of Captain onboard the U.S.S. Excelsior.

crew_archetypes.name: Fencing Sulu
crew_archetypes.flavor: Intoxicated by the Psi 2000 polywater, Sulu viewed himself as a musketeer onboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Sulu
crew_archetypes.flavor: As captain of the U.S.S. Excelsior, Sulu defended the Khitomer peace talks from assassins.

crew_archetypes.name: Tribble Sulu
crew_archetypes.flavor: A large number of cute tribbles give peace and rest to Sulu.

crew_archetypes.name: Botanist Sulu
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sulu enjoyed botany as a hobby, taking care of a carnivorous plant he called Gertrude.

crew_archetypes.name: Doctor M'Benga
crew_archetypes.flavor: A talented medic with a secret, M’Benga reunites with Pike when he serves aboard the Enterprise.

action.name: Somewhere Out There is the Discovery I Need

crew_archetypes.name: King Ridley
crew_archetypes.flavor: M’Benga finds himself cast as King Ridley, a hero in search of a precious artifact in his daughter’s favorite storybook.

crew_archetypes.name: Fly-Fishing M'Benga
crew_archetypes.flavor: During his shore leave, M’Benga chose a quiet activity - fly-fishing.

crew_archetypes.name: M'Benga and Oriana
crew_archetypes.flavor: M'Benga helps Kirk execute their plan to lure out the Gorn, while also taking care of a Valeo Beta V castaway - a young girl named Oriana.

crew_archetypes.name: Mok'Bara M'Benga
crew_archetypes.flavor: While sparring with Dak’Rah, M’Benga learns a lot about his opponent. But lingering anger from the war weaves its way into their match.

action.name: Are You Sure You're Up For Full Impact?

crew_archetypes.name: Liana
crew_archetypes.flavor: Liana’s never seen anyone but her father and the holograms. On meeting the Enterprise crew, she quickly develops feelings for Tucker.

action.name: They Do What I Ask Them To

crew_archetypes.name: Courier Zareh
crew_archetypes.flavor: A courier in the 32nd Century, Zareh cruelly exploited The Colony as its only mercantile connection to the galaxy.

action.name: All That Matters Now Is Dilithium

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Chekov
crew_archetypes.flavor: In order to recrystalize the HMS Bounty's dilithium crystals, Chekov harvested gamma rays from the Navy carrier U.S.S. Enterprise.

action.name: We're In A Lot Of Trouble
We've Got To Get Out Of Here

crew_archetypes.name: Platonian Chekov
crew_archetypes.flavor: Transported down for the Platonians' entertainment, Chekov is prepared with a Kironide cocktail to better defend himself.

crew_archetypes.name: Tribble Chekov
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chekov accompanies Uhura to the bar aboard Deep Space K-7, where they see a tribble for the very first time.

crew_archetypes.name: Assistant Kes
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kes is really interested in the Doctor's experiment with his holographic family. Therefore, she gladly helps him and even agrees to come to dinner to meet the Doctor's family.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Black
crew_archetypes.flavor: Admiral Black was quick to take charge when the situation called for it, but the animosity and mistrust so rampant in the Terran Empire would be his undoing.

crew_archetypes.name: Gotana-Retz
crew_archetypes.flavor: An astronaut from the planet Kelemane, where there was a major time shift. During the Orbital 1 mission, he managed to survive the time shift and help Voyager enter orbit.

crew_archetypes.name: Thalen
crew_archetypes.flavor: Xindi-Primate engineer working on the Xindi weapon. When captured, his voice was stolen for the search for the Azati Prime system.

action.name: I'm Losing Your Signal. Please Repeat.

crew_archetypes.name: Chancellor Azetbur
crew_archetypes.flavor: As the daughter of Chancellor Gorkon, she succeeds him after his assassination and will do anything to accomplish the future he yearned for.

crew_archetypes.name: Wyatt Earp
crew_archetypes.flavor: Created by the Melkot to punish a trespassing party of the Enterprise, this replica of a wild west icon believes Kirk, Spock, Bones, Scotty, and Chekov to be members of the Clanton gang.

crew_archetypes.name: The Duras Sisters
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Duras sisters prosecuted a civil war to replace Gowron as Chancellor with their nephew Toral.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Dexter Remmick
crew_archetypes.flavor: Inhabited by a parasite, Remmick infiltrated Starfleet Command to compromise their command structure for nefarious purposes.

crew_archetypes.name: Platonian Chapel
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chapel was beamed down and under the control of the Platonians until the kironide kicked in.

crew_archetypes.name: Civilian Exchange Chapel
crew_archetypes.flavor: Nurse Chapel is on civilian exchange from the Stanford Morehouse Epigenetic Project under Doctor M’Benga.

crew_archetypes.name: Date Night Chapel
crew_archetypes.flavor: When it comes to relationship advice, Christine Chapel is the friend you need. This doesn’t mean she’s good at her own relationships.

crew_archetypes.name: Lady Audrey Chapel
crew_archetypes.flavor: In the role of Lady Audrey, Chapel becomes a spiritual healer, able to feel the pain of others.

crew_archetypes.name: One Way Ticket Chapel
crew_archetypes.flavor: While treating the injured on Cajitar IV, Chapel and M’Benga are brought by Klingon extremists aboard a makeshift Federation ship, where they must attempt a risky escape.

action.name: I Can't Believe This Is How We're Gonna Die

crew_archetypes.name: Quality of Mercy Chapel
crew_archetypes.flavor: In the alternate universe, Chapel faces a difficult ordeal: trying to save Spock, but knowing her efforts are likely futile.

action.name: I'm Not Sure That He Will Recover From This

crew_archetypes.name: Comm Officer Uhura
crew_archetypes.flavor: Communications Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise, she would later be promoted to Commander on the U.S.S. Enterprise-A.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Uhura
crew_archetypes.flavor: Commander Uhura served under Captain Spock during the attempted theft of the Genesis Device.

crew_archetypes.name: Tribble Uhura
crew_archetypes.flavor: Uhura buys a tribble from intergalactic trader.

crew_archetypes.name: Pathfinder Uhura
crew_archetypes.flavor: Nyota Uhura's impact on the cosmos cannot be overstated, both on and off the screen.

crew_archetypes.name: Queen Neve
crew_archetypes.flavor: The villain of the Kingdom of Elysian, Queen Neve will bring King Ridley’s kingdom to its knees until she gets the mercury stone.

crew_archetypes.name: Technician Uhura
crew_archetypes.flavor: When all means of communication are destroyed due to “Apollo”, Uhura manages to establish alternative means of communication and reconnect.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Uhura
crew_archetypes.flavor: Deployed to investigate a mysterious asteroid, Uhura discovers that her communication abilities are crucial to the mission.

action.name: So the Right Time for Genius

crew_archetypes.name: Uhura in Visions
crew_archetypes.flavor: Uhura is the only one on the ship who hears a strange sound that causes frightening hallucinations.

action.name: Uh, Look, I Really Don't Want To Be Hit On Right Now

crew_archetypes.name: Orion Hurricane Uhura
crew_archetypes.flavor: At Pike's party, Ortegas reveals that getting Uhura to loosen up just takes making it feel like work.

crew_archetypes.name: Tam Elbrun
crew_archetypes.flavor: He was called for a first contact mission in 2366 when an alien intelligence of an organic starship, codenamed 'Tin Man', was discovered.

crew_archetypes.name: Teenager Nog
crew_archetypes.flavor: Son of Rom and Prinadora, Nog was a waiter for his uncle at Quark's Bar on Deep Space Nine.

crew_archetypes.name: Cadet Nog
crew_archetypes.flavor: Nog became the first Ferengi member of Starfleet, and was assigned to DS9 as part of his cadet field studies.

crew_archetypes.name: Siege Nog
crew_archetypes.flavor: During the siege of AR-558, Nog performed well as a scout, using his superb Ferengi hearing to spot a large column of advancing Jem'Hadar.

action.name: You Can Count On Me, Sir

crew_archetypes.name: Bluffing Nog
crew_archetypes.flavor: When Nog and Quark end up in 1947 as a result of sabotage, Nog decides to bluff to save both himself and his uncle.

action.name: You Want The Truth, I'll Tell You The Truth

crew_archetypes.name: Lursa Duras
crew_archetypes.flavor: The elder of the Duras sisters, Lursa schemed for her family to lead the Klingon Empire.

crew_archetypes.name: Cyrus Redblock
crew_archetypes.flavor: A holographic gangster, this Dixon Hill villain held Starfleet participants hostage during a Holodeck malfunction.

crew_archetypes.name: Adira Tal
crew_archetypes.flavor: Adira, now properly joined with the Trill Symbiont Tal, re-acquires their memories from their previous lives.

crew_archetypes.name: Xahean Adira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sneaking medicine down to the landing party of Theta Zeta, Adira appears as a Xahean.

crew_archetypes.name: Cellist Adira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Struggling with the loss and nuances of their joining, Adira practices the Cello as a way of connecting with Gray

crew_archetypes.name: Away Team Adira
crew_archetypes.flavor: Together with Discovery, Adira goes on their first away mission to repair Deep Space Repair Beta Six because of their experience with programmable matter.

crew_archetypes.name: Doctor Kovich
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kovich’s insight and experience make him a valuable resource to the Federation and the Discovery crew.

action.name: Guess I'm a Man of Widely Varied Interests

crew_archetypes.name: Iden
crew_archetypes.flavor: Iden led a rebellion of sentient holograms against their Hirogen creators, who made them to serve as prey for training simulations.

crew_archetypes.name: Adult Rukiya
crew_archetypes.flavor: Having merged her consciousness with the entity Debra, Rukiya is free from the sickness that kept her locked away. Now, she is the one telling the stories.

crew_archetypes.name: Ibudan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Smuggler, murderer and generally unpleasant person. He escaped from prison with the sole purpose of taking revenge on Odo.

action.name: You'd Better Ask Your Federation Superiors About That One
I'd Hate to Make Your Life Difficult

crew_archetypes.name: Tailor Garak
crew_archetypes.flavor: Garak claims to be 'a simple tailor', but some aboard DS9 believe him to be much more than that.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Garak
crew_archetypes.flavor: Executive Officer of the mirror Terok Nor, Garak favored brutal discipline to maintain order.

crew_archetypes.name: Obsidian Order Garak
crew_archetypes.flavor: Reunited with his mentor Enabran Tain, Garak's first duty was to interrogate a Changeling prisoner: Odo.

crew_archetypes.name: Garak, Elim Garak
crew_archetypes.flavor: Curious as to Bashir's activities, Garak breaks into Bashir's secret agent holoprogram and joins him.

action.name: You May Have Just Saved The Entire Alpha Quadrant

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Garak
crew_archetypes.flavor: Bribed by Sisko, Garak joins O’Brien’s scavenging operation on the booby-trapped Cardassian station, the Empok Nor.

crew_archetypes.name: Hologram Garak
crew_archetypes.flavor: Garak doesn't mind listening to Quark's chatter, but only in the form of a simulation in the holodeck.

crew_archetypes.name: Phased Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: Boimler was helping Rutherford with a transporter experiment and ended up phased after an accident.

crew_archetypes.name: USS Titan Bradward Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: Boimler joins the crew of the USS Titan, where he is promoted to lieutenant junior grade.

action.name: I Don’t Have To Write That Down

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: Bradward Boimler is a command ensign on the USS Cerritos. He is desperate to prove himself a competent and valuable member of the crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Cowpoke Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: Brad Boimler is the rootin'est tootin'est cowpoke around. If he wants to be sheriff someday, he'll have to get used to the itchy chaps.

action.name: This Holodeck Ain't Big Enough for the Both of Us

crew_archetypes.name: Fanboy Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: Get your “Voy” Collector’s Plate ready ‘cause Captain Proton and the creator of Fair Haven, Lt. Tom Paris, will be visiting the Cerritos!

action.name: Fine, You Want to Play It That Way?

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: Boimler is on a satellite repair mission making himself useful and enjoying the view while he still has the opportunity.

crew_archetypes.name: Borg Baby Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: Wanting to get the maximum score for the drill, Boimler passed it over and over again, each time saving more and more Borg babies.

crew_archetypes.name: Excretus of Borg
crew_archetypes.flavor: Boimler finds himself completely assimilated by the Borg during a holoprogram drill. And all he wanted was just to get a perfect score.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: During Mariner’s drill, Terran Boimler exposed her when she greeted him with her left hand.

action.name: Did You Just Salute Me With Your Left Hand?

crew_archetypes.name: Vineyard Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: While on temporary leave, Boimler went to his family's vineyard, where Mariner finds him to propose another adventure.

crew_archetypes.name: Displaced Boimler
crew_archetypes.flavor: Once on the Enterprise, Boimler was incredibly excited about meeting his idols, though keeping his future knowledge under wraps proved to be a challenge.

crew_archetypes.name: Groundskeeper Boothby
crew_archetypes.flavor: Groundskeeper of Starfleet Academy for decades, Boothby's advice was sought by generations of cadets.

action.name: We've Got The Real McCoy Here.

crew_archetypes.name: Commando Shran
crew_archetypes.flavor: An Andorian from the Imperial Guard, Shran confronted Captain Archer on the monastery of P'Jem.

crew_archetypes.name: Ransom Shran
crew_archetypes.flavor: Shran calls in a favor to rescue his daughter being held for ransom.

action.name: Let Me Show You What Will Happen

crew_archetypes.name: General Oh
crew_archetypes.flavor: Having learned of the Synthetics’ homeworld, Oh discards her starfleet guise and marshalls the Romulan fleet to eradicate them.

action.name: Our Great Work Is Nearly At An End

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Hoya
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Benzite ensign, Hoya died during a mission to Torga IV in the Gamma Quadrant.

crew_archetypes.name: Odona
crew_archetypes.flavor: Odona allowed herself to be infected in order to infect the other inhabitants of Gideon and save the planet from overpopulation.

action.name: I Would Rather Die Than Leave

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Kang
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tricked into a confrontation with Kirk, Kang and his counterpart were forced to work together to defeat their incorporeal manipulator.

crew_archetypes.name: Zobral
crew_archetypes.flavor: Rebel Leader turned Terrorist, Zobral leads a clan against the oppressive ruling Torothan Clan on the Torothan homeworld.

action.name: Look Down Every Now And Then

crew_archetypes.name: Riley Frazier
crew_archetypes.flavor: Once science officer of the U.S.S. Roosevelt, Riley was assimilated during the Battle of Wolf 359.

crew_archetypes.name: Stargazer Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Commanding officer of the U.S.S. Stargazer, where he first served as its flight controller.

crew_archetypes.name: Enterprise-D Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the legendary U.S.S. Enterprise-D, Captain Picard was key to many of the Federation's successes.

crew_archetypes.name: Locutus of Borg
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captured by the Borg, Locutus was the name given to an assimilated Jean-Luc Picard.

crew_archetypes.name: Enterprise-E Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Crashed on 21st century Earth, Captain Picard found himself up against the implacable Borg Queen.

crew_archetypes.name: Tommy Gun Dixon
crew_archetypes.flavor: During the attempted assimilation of the Enterprise-E, Picard dispatched a Borg drone with holographic bullets.

crew_archetypes.name: Galen
crew_archetypes.flavor: Picard assumed the role of the smuggler Galen after being captured by raiders searching for a Vulcan psionic weapon.

crew_archetypes.name: Detective Dixon Hill
crew_archetypes.flavor: In his spare time, Picard enjoyed participating in the Dixon Hill collection of holonovels."

crew_archetypes.name: C.O.P. Founder Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Stepping in for the missing Jonathan Archer, Picard helped form the Coalition of Planets. (Second Battle of New York player vote winner!)

crew_archetypes.name: Smitten Jean-Luc Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Picard played the role of Lwaxana's jealous lover in a ploy to rescue her from Daimon Tog.

action.name: Darmok And Jalad On The Ocean

crew_archetypes.name: Kamin Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Influenced by a Kataan probe, Picard assumes the identity of an ironweaver named Kamin

crew_archetypes.name: Vashti Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Before heading to Freecloud to look for Bruce Maddox, Picard visits the Romulan Relocation hub on Vashti to enlist aid.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Picard, Worf, and Hawk cross the exterior hull of the Enterprise on foot to manually disengage the Borg beacon.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Picard Day Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: For a school holiday to celebrate the ship’s captain, a reluctant Picard must pick winners from students’ art projects.

crew_archetypes.name: Resigned Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Picard resigns in protest when Starfleet halts the Romulan evacuation plan following the synth attack on Mars.

crew_archetypes.name: Fencing Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Picard's long-standing hobby allows you not only to keep yourself in shape, but also to rest your soul.

action.name: Nothing Works Just as You Hoped

crew_archetypes.name: 2024 Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Picard finds himself racing to undo a nightmarish future.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. JG Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Offered a choice on an alternate path from his past, Picard sees how a particular moment defined his Starfleet career.

action.name: I Believe That I Can Do More

crew_archetypes.name: Bridge Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: This is the finale - and the last opportunity for Picard and his team to rid the galaxy of its greatest danger.

action.name: What Began Over 35 Years Ago Ends Tonight

crew_archetypes.name: Horseback Picard
crew_archetypes.flavor: Picard's plans included a relaxing ride on a horse on the holodeck, but Riker summoned him to the bridge.

crew_archetypes.name: Bartender Quark
crew_archetypes.flavor: Owner of Quark's Bar, he is one of the more colorful residents of Deep Space Nine.

crew_archetypes.name: Klingon Quark
crew_archetypes.flavor: After a Klingon dies in Quark's bar, his widow Grilka takes Quark to Qo'noS.

action.name: You Can't Climb A Mountain On Crumbs!

crew_archetypes.name: Tribble Quark
crew_archetypes.flavor: Quark must deal with an infestation of Tribbles in his bar.

crew_archetypes.name: Audrid Quark
crew_archetypes.flavor: Quark became a reluctant host to Audrid and his trepidation only increased when he found his personality at odds with hers.

action.name: The Entity That Lent Me This Body Wishes to Speak

crew_archetypes.name: People Person Quark
crew_archetypes.flavor: As a bartender, Quark greatly enjoys interacting with his guests. He has a keen eye for when crew members act out of character.

action.name: Too Quiet. Something Is Terribly Wrong.

crew_archetypes.name: Bar Owner Quark
crew_archetypes.flavor: Quark plunged headlong into business - and by 2381 he already had his own chain of bars 'Quark's Bar'.

crew_archetypes.name: Explorer Cutler
crew_archetypes.flavor: An entomologist, Cutler's expertise was in high demand on the surface of the planet that would become Archer IV.

action.name: Thanks For Choosing Me For This Mission

crew_archetypes.name: General Martok
crew_archetypes.flavor: A gifted Klingon fighter, Martok rose to the rank of General and, eventually Chancellor of the Klingon Empire.

crew_archetypes.name: 23rd Century Martok
crew_archetypes.flavor: A version of Martok from an alternate universe, born into the Klingon Empire during the twenty-third century.

action.name: I will fight any battle. Anywhere

crew_archetypes.name: Reclamation Narissa
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Zhat Vash agent in charge of gaining information at the Borg Reclamation project.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Rizzo
crew_archetypes.flavor: Under the direction of Commodore Oh, Narissa poses as a human Starfleet agent in order to hunt biological androids.

action.name: I’ve Put My Best Man On It

crew_archetypes.name: Berlinghoff Rasmussen
crew_archetypes.flavor: A 22nd Century 'inventor', Rasmussen posed as a historian from the future to steal from the Enterprise-D.

crew_archetypes.name: Acting Chief Engineer Joe Carey
crew_archetypes.flavor: After the tragic events in the Delta Quadrant, Carey became the Chief Engineer, a position he was reluctant to give up.

action.name: I'm The Senior Officer And I Speak For Engineering

crew_archetypes.name: Forra Gegen
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Voth molecular paleontologist, Gegen learned that the saurian species had originally developed on Earth.

crew_archetypes.name: Klingon West
crew_archetypes.flavor: In an attempt to assassinate the Federation President, Colonel West dons the disguise of a Klingon.

crew_archetypes.name: Telek R'Mor
crew_archetypes.flavor: Conducting research near a wormhole, Telek R'Mor agreed to carry a message from the stranded U.S.S. Voyager.

crew_archetypes.name: Fifth Dimension Invader
crew_archetypes.flavor: One of the two photonic aliens who mistakenly believed the Captain Proton holodeck program was real and were at war with Doctor Chaotica.

crew_archetypes.name: Chuft-Captain
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chuft-Captain commanded the Kzinti forces of The Traitor’s Claw in an ill-fated attempt to gain relics of war from Slaver stasis boxes.

action.name: You Are Meat for Our Tables

crew_archetypes.name: Kai Opaka
crew_archetypes.flavor: Spiritual leader of the Bajoran people during the Occupation, Opaka was the first to recognize Sisko as Emissary.

crew_archetypes.name: Twin Mistresses of Evil
crew_archetypes.flavor: A pair of villainesses from the Captain Proton holoprogram, played skillfully by twin crew members, Jenny and Megan Delaney.

action.name: You'll Be Our Puppet. Our Slave.

crew_archetypes.name: Security Chief Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: Security Chief for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, he was the first Klingon to graduate from Starfleet Academy.

crew_archetypes.name: Defiant Commander Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: Commander of the U.S.S. Defiant, a warship that saw action against the Dominion and Borg.

crew_archetypes.name: Civil War Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: Called to defend the Empire in the civil war, Worf set aside his Starfleet commission to fight for Gowron.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Regent Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: The brutal Regent of the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance in a mirror universe.

crew_archetypes.name: Will Scarlett
crew_archetypes.flavor: Forced to fill the role of Will Scarlett in Q's Robin Hood scenario, Worf was 'not a merry man'.

crew_archetypes.name: Duchamps
crew_archetypes.flavor: After a transporter accident, Worf's image is used by a holosuite program to display Doctor Noah's henchman.

crew_archetypes.name: Colonel Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: A respected advocate, Colonel Worf represented Kirk and McCoy at their murder trial on Qo'noS.

action.name: I Didn't Bring A Bathing Suit

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: After Hawk was assimilated, Worf stepped into action to rescue Picard and destroy the Borg Beacon.

crew_archetypes.name: Midwife Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: During a ship-wide emergency, Worf must aid a pregnant Keiko O’Brien when she suddenly goes into labor.

crew_archetypes.name: Willie Hawkins
crew_archetypes.flavor: A famous baseball player and friend of Benny Russell who also flirts with Cassie during Sisko’s vision.

crew_archetypes.name: Kal'Hyah Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: In preparation for his wedding with Jadzia, Worf and his friends undergo the trials of Kal’Hyah.

action.name: We Must Make The Best Of It

crew_archetypes.name: Mok'bara Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: Worf teaches Jaxa using a fake advancement test he calls a gik’tail to encourage her to speak up.

crew_archetypes.name: Handler Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: Worf, son of Mogh, of the Houses of Martok and Rhozhenko, bane of the Duras family and slayer of Gowron, breaks his commitment to pacifism to save Raffi.

action.name: I Told You, Do Not Engage

crew_archetypes.name: Bridge Worf
crew_archetypes.flavor: A warrior from birth, Worf gives it his all in the final battle with the Borg.

crew_archetypes.name: Laneth
crew_archetypes.flavor: “A subject of a genetic augmentation gone wrong, Laneth struggles to retain her Klingon heart.”

action.name: I Die Not For Myself But For You

crew_archetypes.name: Nausicaan Thug
crew_archetypes.flavor: One of Nausicaan dom-jot players who stabbed Picard in the heart during a bar fight.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Taurik
crew_archetypes.flavor: A witty and inquisitive Vulcan who befriended several ensigns. He was enthusiastic about his work with La Forge on the warp drive.

crew_archetypes.name: Su'Kal
crew_archetypes.flavor: Su'Kal lives in a hologram made by his mother before her death. To be saved, he must face his greatest fear - another reality

action.name: A Poker Face Carved In Marble

crew_archetypes.name: Dexa
crew_archetypes.flavor: On a remote asteroid, Dexa stands with her fellow Talaxians against miners who would see their new home destroyed for minerals.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Nevesa
crew_archetypes.flavor: Commander of a Romulan vessel, Nevesa was captured by the Enterprise crew while trying to prevent Spock's escape from her ship.

crew_archetypes.name: Kilana
crew_archetypes.flavor: In command of a squad of Jem'Hadar, Kilana ordered her troops to attack Sisko's crew to rescue a wounded Founder.

crew_archetypes.name: Zarabeth
crew_archetypes.flavor: Trapped alone five thousand years in the past, Zarabeth falls for a surprise visitor: Spock.

crew_archetypes.name: Nona
crew_archetypes.flavor: Fighting for what she believes is right, Nona betrays her husband to stop her people from becoming rulers.

crew_archetypes.name: Zyree
crew_archetypes.flavor: Zyree helps to coordinate a deal for the Ferengi and a large quantity of Tulaberry wine.

action.name: This Is Where Opportunities Are Made

crew_archetypes.name: The Professor
crew_archetypes.flavor: Built by the Enterprise's computer, The Professor was built to be Detective Data's ultimate challenge.

crew_archetypes.name: Fred
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Soong-type Android over 600 years old, his keen interest in centuries-old artifacts places the Q’Mau fence in grave danger.

action.name: How Effervescent To Meet New Clients

crew_archetypes.name: Lieutenant Arex Na Eth
crew_archetypes.flavor: Navigator aboard the Enterprise, Arex found himself playing his lute under the influence of a love potion.

crew_archetypes.name: Acting Captain Arex
crew_archetypes.flavor: Amid the rash of strange pranks aboard the Enterprise, Arex takes the role of acting captain while the rest of the bridge crew have lunch.

action.name: We Didn't Cause This To Happen
Not a Conversation Killer at All

crew_archetypes.name: Borg Queen Jurati
crew_archetypes.flavor: Having achieved harmony with the Borg Queen's consciousness, Jurati has forged a new and more humane collective aimed at saving lives.

crew_archetypes.name: Devious Duet Jurati
crew_archetypes.flavor: In a covert mission to restore the timeline, Jurati takes center stage during a gala, but in her performance it becomes apparent that the Borg Queen has taken over.

action.name: This President Is Not Above The Law

crew_archetypes.name: Yeoman Rand
crew_archetypes.flavor: Assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise, Yeoman Rand served faithfully in the Operations division.

crew_archetypes.name: Off Duty Janice Rand
crew_archetypes.flavor: In 2266, Yeoman Janice Rand had an encounter with a young boy who could not control Thasian powers.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Marie Kaplan
crew_archetypes.flavor: A member of the USS Voyager crew who died while responding to a distress call.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Vance
crew_archetypes.flavor: The leader of the Federation in 32nd century. After the Burn, his belief that the Federation could be revived was rapidly fading.

action.name: The Past Is The Only Light With Which We Can See The Future.

crew_archetypes.name: Salia
crew_archetypes.flavor: Born to parents of rival factions, Salia is destined to unite her people as a neutral ruler.

action.name: Let's Not Say Goodbye Like This

crew_archetypes.name: Ruon Tarka
crew_archetypes.flavor: Originally tasked with understanding the Dark Matter Anomaly, Ruon Tarka became obsessed with destroying it through dangerous means.

crew_archetypes.name: T'Kuvma
crew_archetypes.flavor: T'Kuvma sought to unify the fractious Klingon Empire against the Federation.

crew_archetypes.name: Patar
crew_archetypes.flavor: Patar believed that turning control over decision-making to artificial intelligence would help avoid threats in the future.

crew_archetypes.name: Doopler Emissary
crew_archetypes.flavor: As a trade emissary, this Doopler must keep his social anxiety under control to prevent dangerous exponential dooplercation.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. Simon van Gelder
crew_archetypes.flavor: A talented psychologist and the director of Tantalus Penal Colony. His memories were secretly damaged by his colleague Dr. Adams.

action.name: Edited, Adjusted, Subverted Me, But I Won't Forget!

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Nechayev
crew_archetypes.flavor: Vice Admiral Nechayev commanded Starfleet operations in the vicinity of the Cardassian Union.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Seska
crew_archetypes.flavor: Serving on the Val Jean as a Maquis, Seska was later revealed to be a Cardassian operative disguised as a Bajoran.

crew_archetypes.name: Kazon Seska
crew_archetypes.flavor: After leaving Voyager, Seska later joined the Kazon as consort to First Maje Culluh.

crew_archetypes.name: Maquis Takeover Seska
crew_archetypes.flavor: A year after her death, Seska leaves one last surprise for the Voyager crew in an abandoned holoprogram.

crew_archetypes.name: Seska and Culluh
crew_archetypes.flavor: Seska and Culluh teamed up to gain advanced Starfleet technology. To achieve their goals, they often resorted to manipulation and tricks.

crew_archetypes.name: Emotionally Heightened T'Lyn
crew_archetypes.flavor: T'Lyn, according to her colleagues, is too emotional for a Vulcan. Though her intuitive decisions were useful, she was still transferred to the Cerritos.

action.name: Logic Is The Beginning Of Wisdom, Not The End

crew_archetypes.name: Kevin Uxbridge
crew_archetypes.flavor: “An immortal being sworn to pacifism grapples with the ramifications of his grief and rage.”

action.name: You don’t understand the scope of my crime
You Can Make A Difference Here
That Which Is Imperfect Must Be Sterilized

crew_archetypes.name: Arachnia Janeway
crew_archetypes.flavor: Queen of the Spider People in the 'Captain Proton' holonovels, Janeway assumed her role to defeat Doctor Chaotica.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Janeway
crew_archetypes.flavor: Within two years of successfully returning home from the Delta Quadrant, Janeway was promoted to the rank of Vice Admiral.

crew_archetypes.name: Assimilated Janeway
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain Janeway allowed herself to be partially assimilated to deliver a nanovirus to the Borg.

action.name: I Don't Respond Well To Threats

crew_archetypes.name: Polaric Janeway
crew_archetypes.flavor: After being sucked through a temporal anomaly with Lt. Paris, Janeway tries to save a planet from her team’s attempt to rescue them.

crew_archetypes.name: Disguised Janeway
crew_archetypes.flavor: Janeway and the away team blend into 20th century Los Angeles to pinpoint the location of Captain Braxton.

crew_archetypes.name: Puppy-Placated Janeway
crew_archetypes.flavor: With Q’s persistent attempts to pursue Janeway romantically, he aims to win her heart by sharing his vulnerability, and a puppy.

crew_archetypes.name: C.O.P. Janeway
crew_archetypes.flavor: After guiding Voyager through seven years in the Delta Quadrant, lighting the way for the Federation's predecessor should be a simple matter.

action.name: If the Coalition of Planets Needs Us, We Are Here to Help

crew_archetypes.name: Tearful Janeway
crew_archetypes.flavor: Some decisions are too difficult. And despite looking stern during the separation process, Janeway can barely contain her emotions afterward.

crew_archetypes.name: Concerning Flight Janeway
crew_archetypes.flavor: In the holodeck, Janeway and Da Vinci hide from their pursuers in the wilderness, where they manage to fly on the Great Bird.

crew_archetypes.name: Enabran Tain
crew_archetypes.flavor: Former head of the Obsidian Order, Enabran Tain organized a sneak attack against the Founder homeworld.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Loskene
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Tholian ship commander who snapped up the USS Enterprise, ordering it to leave Tholian Space.

action.name: You Must Leave This Area Immediately

crew_archetypes.name: Facer Rios
crew_archetypes.flavor: Posing as a ‘facer on Freecloud, Rios introduces a disguised Picard to Bjayzl’s associate Mr. Vup in order to rescue Maddox.

crew_archetypes.name: Farewell Rios
crew_archetypes.flavor: Rios finally found a place he felt at home on Earth in the 21st century. He stayed to create a better future.

crew_archetypes.name: Will Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: First Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, William Riker went on to have a storied career in Starfleet.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Thomas Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Split from William Riker in a transporter accident, Thomas Riker was stranded alone for eight years.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: When off-duty, Commander Riker often held poker nights for his fellow bridge officers.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Originally from Q's final test of Picard, Admiral Riker used the Enterprise-D to seal an anti-time rift.

crew_archetypes.name: Mintakan Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: On a mission to gauge cultural contamination on Mintaka, Riker presented himself as a Mintakan trader.

crew_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Zheng He Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leaving a life of bunnicorn sausage pizza temporarily behind him, Riker brought the U.S.S. Zheng He to the aid of Picard on Coppelius.

crew_archetypes.name: Regency Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: An unsuspecting Riker is suddenly swept from a date in Ten Forward into a Jane Austen-esque garden by Amanda Rogers’s newfound powers

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Picard Day Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Riker puts on his best Picard impression to poke fun at the captain.

crew_archetypes.name: Worst Contact Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Riker and his team make first contact with a new civilization whose ways of showing respect are very peculiar.

crew_archetypes.name: Night Terrors Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Riker jumps out of bed and finds snakes wrapped around his leg. But a moment later they are no longer there - it was a hallucination.

action.name: I'd Be a Liar If I Said I Felt Like Myself

crew_archetypes.name: Bridge Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: To defeat the Borg, you need to be quite risky and focused on your goal. Luckily, Riker is just that.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Kirsten Clancy
crew_archetypes.flavor: Fleet Admiral and Commander in Chief of Starfleet at the end of the twenty-fourth century.

crew_archetypes.name: Marla McGivers
crew_archetypes.flavor: Enterprise ship's historian, Marla assisted Khan's coup and followed him into exile on Ceti Alpha V.

crew_archetypes.name: Chief Engineer La Forge
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief Engineer of the Enterprise-D, Geordi La Forge was an important and gifted member of the crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander La Forge
crew_archetypes.flavor: After tangling with the Borg, Geordi found himself and the Enterprise-E back in 2063.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain La Forge
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the U.S.S. Challenger, Geordi tried to prevent Kim and Chakotay from changing the past to save Voyager.

crew_archetypes.name: Surata IV La Forge
crew_archetypes.flavor: Geordi uses himself as bait with some hostile vines, knowing he can count on Data’s quick android reflexes.

crew_archetypes.name: All Good Things La Forge
crew_archetypes.flavor: Due to Q's time rips, La Forge and Picard meet in the future, and La Forge helps the Captain get to the Neutral Zone to close the rifts.

action.name: I'm Trying, But There's a Lot of Interference

crew_archetypes.name: Bridge La Forge
crew_archetypes.flavor: Geordi’s secret restoration project becomes a key point of resistance against the Borg.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Kurn
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kurn, son of Mogh, joined the Officer Exchange Program to meet his long-lost brother, Worf.

crew_archetypes.name: Koloth
crew_archetypes.flavor: Commander of the Klingon vessel I.K.S Gr'oth, Koloth encountered Kirk at Deep Space Station K7.

crew_archetypes.name: Tribbled Koloth and Korax
crew_archetypes.flavor: Not even the genetically engineered tribble hunting Glommer can manage to dig Koloth and Korax out of this particular pile of troubles.

crew_archetypes.name: Drone Magnus Hansen
crew_archetypes.flavor: An exobiologist who was assimilated along with his family during the capture of USS Raven.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Sonya Gomez
crew_archetypes.flavor: Being an attentive and insightful captain, Gomez, together with the crew of the Cerritos, successfully completes the first contact mission.

action.name: Take Us In, Nice And Slow

crew_archetypes.name: Ambassador V'Lar
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ambassador V’Lar uses her trip aboard the Enterprise to expose the Mazarites.

action.name: We've Kept Many Things From Them

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Rita Tannenbaum
crew_archetypes.flavor: From Quark’s to Gaia to the Rikers’ wedding, this Deep Space Nine engineer may be inconspicuous, but is always there.

action.name: A Good Engineer Is Ready For Anything

crew_archetypes.name: Compromised Kamran Gant
crew_archetypes.flavor: After Gant was reanimated by Control, he lured Michael Burnham to ‘reconstruct’ her.

action.name: To Achieve One Requires The Other

crew_archetypes.name: Bela Oxmyx
crew_archetypes.flavor: Prominent Iotian male, boss of the syndicate that unites all territories on the planet.

crew_archetypes.name: Degraded Sphere-Builder
crew_archetypes.flavor: Promised freedom in exchange for participating in an experiment, this Sphere Builder learned that his only freedom might come in complete cellular degradation.

action.name: When The Xindi Destroy Earth, My People Will Prevail

crew_archetypes.name: Emory Erickson
crew_archetypes.flavor: Under false pretenses, Erickson sought to use his invention of the molecular transporter to save his son trapped in sub-space.

action.name: You’ll Be Able To Leave The Lights On

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Rudolph Ransom
crew_archetypes.flavor: An exobiologist who was promoted to captain of a science ship after making first contact with the supposedly extinct Yridians.

crew_archetypes.name: Displaced Molly O'Brien
crew_archetypes.flavor: Molly is rescued from a temporal portal and returned to Deep Space Nine, but only after ten years passed for her on an uninhabited planet.

crew_archetypes.name: Henry Starling
crew_archetypes.flavor: Henry Starling ushers in the computing revolution by salvaging a wrecked time ship. Now, he looks to travel to the future to take even more.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral Cartwright
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Starfleet admiral, Cartwright was a conspirator in the plot to sabotage the Klingon-Federation peace summit.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. Brown
crew_archetypes.flavor: After the tragedy on Exo II, Dr. Brown continued to be Corby's assistant, but now as an android.

crew_archetypes.name: Countess Regina Bartholomew
crew_archetypes.flavor: A woman of breeding, wit and sagacity. Intelligent, insightful and adventurous. She is adored by The Professor.

action.name: Are You Suggesting That It's Beyond My Comprehension?

crew_archetypes.name: Kejal
crew_archetypes.flavor: A hologram created in the likeness of a Cardassian. Was created as prey for a holographic training regimen, but was rescued by Iden.

action.name: I'm Not A Cardassian, I'm A Hologram

crew_archetypes.name: Kukulkan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Reappearing after thousands of years, Kukulkan is enraged that almost nobody remembers him and threatens to eliminate all life aboard the Enterprise.

action.name: All of Your Kind Shall Perish!

crew_archetypes.name: Prince Billups
crew_archetypes.flavor: Despite all his mother’s tricks and deceptions, Billups never became king and remained in Starfleet.

action.name: This Is A New Low, Mother

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Tribble
crew_archetypes.flavor: A particularly perseverant tribble troubles Kirk when it seizes the captain's chair during a dispute with Klingon forces.

crew_archetypes.name: Chief Engineer Pelia
crew_archetypes.flavor: Teaching at the Academy bored Pelia. Therefore, she helped the crew steal the Enterprise, thanks to which she took the position of chief engineer.

action.name: If You're Going To Steal a Starship, Do It Correctly

crew_archetypes.name: Inspection Pelia
crew_archetypes.flavor: Pelia came onboard as the Enterprise’s new chief engineer, but found the shoes she had to fill were great and the holes in the hearts of the crew even greater.

crew_archetypes.name: Solkar
crew_archetypes.flavor: The first (officially recorded) contact between Vulcans and Humans was the moment this Vulcan met the human Zephram Cochrane.

crew_archetypes.name: AGIMUS
crew_archetypes.flavor: AGIMUS has a knack for sowing discord in order to upload himself into position of power.

action.name: You Are Too Late, AGIMUS Reigns!

crew_archetypes.name: Victorious AGIMUS
crew_archetypes.flavor: AGIMUS is sure he won after 'convincing' Boimler to connect him to the ship's computer, but is the machine about to 'Boim' himself?

action.name: This Planet... Nay, This System... Will Be Mine!

crew_archetypes.name: Steward Kyheem
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kyheem serves as Steward of the Sanctuary in order to protect the Kwejian harvests from sea locusts.

crew_archetypes.name: Ikhu Zhen Kyheem
crew_archetypes.flavor: After a long grudge against his brother, Kyheem reconciles with him and even asks him to perform the Ikhu Zhen ceremony for his son.

crew_archetypes.name: Leila Kalomi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leila fell in love with Spock, and was happy when mind-altering spores made him return her affection. It didn’t last.

crew_archetypes.name: Badgey
crew_archetypes.flavor: A virtual tutor developed by Ensign Rutherford, Badgey can walk you through any Starfleet exercise you can imagine.

action.name: Hi, Can I Teach You A Lesson?

crew_archetypes.name: Corrupted Badgey
crew_archetypes.flavor: Corrupted by his creator’s abuse, Badgey seeks revenge on Rutherford and those he cares about.

action.name: Can I Teach You A Lesson?

crew_archetypes.name: Richard Castillo
crew_archetypes.flavor: Helmsman of the Enterprise-C, Castillo assumed command after Captain Garrett was killed.

crew_archetypes.name: Appropriate Attire Nevesa
crew_archetypes.flavor: This Romulan commander sees winning Spock’s heart as a way to win power and influence in the Empire - by using him to help her capture the Enterprise.

action.name: Then There Is A Truth Here That Remains Unspoken

crew_archetypes.name: George and Gracie
crew_archetypes.flavor: After being rescued from whalers by Kirk and crew in 1986, these heroes saved the world in the 23rd century by singing at a deep space probe

crew_archetypes.name: The Pahvan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Intelligent inhabitants of the planet Pahvo, living in complete harmony with the world around them.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Tomalak
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Romulan Commander who confronted the U.S.S. Enterprise-D on several occasions.

crew_archetypes.name: Axum
crew_archetypes.flavor: With the help of the Voyager crew, Axum set the Unimatrix Zero drones free, and became leader of the resistance movement against the Borg.

crew_archetypes.name: Weyoun Clone 4
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Vorta clone who oversaw a Jem'Hadar attack ship. Later killed after eradicating a Jem'Hadar rebellion.

crew_archetypes.name: Kevin Mulkahey
crew_archetypes.flavor: In one of Sisko's visions, Mulkahey was a plainclothes police officer in 1950’s New York who abused his power to harass Benny Russell.

crew_archetypes.name: Osyraa
crew_archetypes.flavor: Her attempts at diplomacy with the Federation having failed, Osyraa hijacks the USS Discovery and attacks Federation HQ.

crew_archetypes.name: Chief Engineer Torres
crew_archetypes.flavor: A half-Klingon Maquis officer who later joined the U.S.S. Voyager as Chief Engineer.

crew_archetypes.name: Maquis Takeover Torres
crew_archetypes.flavor: Torres, under the control of Teero Anaydis, helped lead a Maquis revolt on the U.S.S. Voyager.

action.name: Brute Force Isn't Going To Do It
You Know How Much I Hate To Lose
I'm Going To Get This One

crew_archetypes.name: Barge of the Dead Torres
crew_archetypes.flavor: While unconscious, Torres finds her mother aboard the Barge of the Dead, bound for Gre’Thor, the realm of the Klingon afterlife meant for dishonored souls.

crew_archetypes.name: Orbital Skydiving Torres
crew_archetypes.flavor: B'Elanna engages in increasingly risky behavior in the Holodeck while mourning the loss of her Maquis crewmates.

crew_archetypes.name: Luau Torres
crew_archetypes.flavor: Torres appears at the luau in a tropical dress, and looks simply smashing.

action.name: Why Don't You Take a Break?

crew_archetypes.name: Caretaker Torres
crew_archetypes.flavor: Torres wakes up in a medical lab, where the Ocampan doctor informs her and Kim that he is protecting his population from 'their' disease.

action.name: I Don't Find This At All Amusing, Starfleet

crew_archetypes.name: Warship Torres
crew_archetypes.flavor: This ruthless half-Klingon warrior is believed to have helped engineer some of Voyager’s deadliest weapons.

action.name: It's A Little Late To Be Having Second Thoughts

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Ortegas
crew_archetypes.flavor: Helmsman of the U.S.S Enterprise under Captain Pike’s command, she brags about being the best pilot to graduate the academy.

crew_archetypes.name: Off-Duty Ortegas
crew_archetypes.flavor: As a light practical joke, Ortegas convinces Uhura to wear her dress uniform to the captain’s table.

action.name: Consider This Your First Square in Enterprise Bingo

crew_archetypes.name: Sir Adya Ortegas
crew_archetypes.flavor: Brought into the world of 'The Kingdom of Elysian', Ortegas becomes Sir Adya - the king’s faithful and devoted knight.

action.name: My King, We Have Been Led Into A Trap

crew_archetypes.name: Kalar Ortegas
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ortegas excitedly prepares for an operation on Rigel VII. Discouraged she can’t go, she may be right where she is needed most.

crew_archetypes.name: Orion Hurricane Ortegas
crew_archetypes.flavor: After getting an entire bottle of Orion delaq, Ortegas makes authentic Orion Hurricanes for everyone for Pike's birthday party.

action.name: Caras Gave Us a Bottle of Real Orion Delaq

crew_archetypes.name: Chancellor K'mpec
crew_archetypes.flavor: K'mpec was the Klingon Chancellor, ready for anything to keep peace in the Klingon Empire.

action.name: The Empire Will Not Be Destroyed
Give Life, Kill, It Is All The Same

crew_archetypes.name: Syrran
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Vulcan philosopher who guides Archer and T'Pol across Vulcan's Forge.

crew_archetypes.name: Cadet Harral
crew_archetypes.flavor: Along with other cadets, Harral took part in the research exercise on Geryon. As an Orion, he has had to work hard to earn trust and respect.

action.name: I Have To Work Twice As Hard

crew_archetypes.name: Tiron
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tiron gives Quark generous financial incentive to get him a 'custom' holosuite program featuring Major Kira.

crew_archetypes.name: Migleemo
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Cerritos’ counselor who is infamous for his inane food metaphors.

action.name: I Want You To Be A Cantaloupe

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Demos
crew_archetypes.flavor: An agent of the Dramen government who served Leonard McCoy with an arrest warrant for mass murder on Dramia II.

crew_archetypes.name: Sord
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Vedala recruited Sord alongside Kirk, Spock, Em/3/Green, Lara, and Tchar to retrieve the Soul of the Skorr to prevent the start of a war.

crew_archetypes.name: Jae Hwang
