crew_archetypes.flavor: Jae is Raffi's ex-husband. During a meeting at his bar on M’Talas Prime, he mistakenly believed that Raffi wanted to reunite with their son, but she needed help finding Sneed.

action.name: Right Here, Right Now. Make A Choice.

crew_archetypes.name: Carl, Guardian of Forever
crew_archetypes.flavor: Carl, a new visual representation of the Guardian, stands guard over a trans-dimensional door in the thirty-second Century.

action.name: There's More Than One Way to Die.

crew_archetypes.name: Section 31 Reed
crew_archetypes.flavor: Pushed into serving Section 31, Malcolm Reed investigated a secret Klingon program.

crew_archetypes.name: Tourist Reed
crew_archetypes.flavor: Looking for some company on the pleasure planet of Risa, Malcolm Reed ends up in a desperate situation.

action.name: Follow Two Aliens into a Basement

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Reed
crew_archetypes.flavor: After Mayweather injures his leg while exploring Archer’s Comet, Reed helps him to escape.

crew_archetypes.name: Twilight Reed
crew_archetypes.flavor: In the alternate timeline, Reed was promoted to be captain of the Intrepid. However, he did not assume command due to the Xindi attack.

crew_archetypes.name: T'Pring
crew_archetypes.flavor: Not quite Spock’s wife and not quite his betrothed, T’Pring claimed kal-if-fee in order to be with Stonn instead.

crew_archetypes.name: T'Pring as Spock
crew_archetypes.flavor: Once in Spock's body, T'Pring is forced to do all his tasks, including negotiating with the R'ongovians, until the switch is undone.

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. JG Kayshon
crew_archetypes.flavor: As the first Tamarian in Starfleet, Kayshon's time on the Cerritos includes being turned into a puppet and frequent mistranslations.

action.name: Bazminti When He Pulled Back The Veil Vibes

crew_archetypes.name: Kelis
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kelis, a playwright, seeks to use his plays as a way to prevent war between rival factions on his home planet.

action.name: I Am Trying To Save You

crew_archetypes.name: First Officer Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Starfleet commander, Michael Burnham was the first officer of the U.S.S. Shenzhou.

action.name: I'm Not Staying To Make Friends
The Old Michael Burnham is Dead

crew_archetypes.name: Courier Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: Joining up with Booker, Burnham helps as a courier while she awaits the return of Discovery.

crew_archetypes.name: Trill Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: A malfunctioning holoprogram aboard the wreckage of the KSF Khi'eth made Burnham appear Trill.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: Stepping up as captain of the Discovery, Burnham is ready to face future challenges.

crew_archetypes.name: Resistance Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: Commander Burnham is always trying to find a peaceful resolution, but is also ready to think outside the box.

crew_archetypes.name: Inspiring Captain Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: As captain of the Discovery, Burnham continues her work to reignite the Federation and discover incredible new worlds.

crew_archetypes.name: Burnham at the Jump
crew_archetypes.flavor: With the U.S.S. Discovery fully equipped with a spore drive, Captain Burnham prepares to jump to a distressed station.

crew_archetypes.name: Academy Speech Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: After over a century's absence Starfleet Academy rises again, and it’s now up to the new graduates to define the future of the Federation.

action.name: I Feel Like Anything is Possible

crew_archetypes.name: Out of Time Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: Burnham survives being blown out into space, but she isn’t ready to give up her pursuit just yet.

crew_archetypes.name: Jogging Burnham
crew_archetypes.flavor: Burnham and Tilly forge a fierce friendship that helps both of them overcome the obstacles facing them together, bringing out the best in each other.

action.name: See Your Path. Stay On It. Reach Your Destination.

crew_archetypes.name: Luther Sloan
crew_archetypes.flavor: An operative in the Section 31 intelligence agency, he frequently sparred with Julian Bashir.

crew_archetypes.name: Jojo Krako
crew_archetypes.flavor: Krako was a gangster boss on Sigma Iotia II who managed to stop the violence between two warring gangs through his actions.

action.name: I Haven't Been Arrested In My Whole Life!

crew_archetypes.name: Cadet Sito Jaxa
crew_archetypes.flavor: While member of Nova Squadron, Sito Jaxa survived a flying accident that killed one of her fellow cadets.

crew_archetypes.name: Mok'bara Sito Jaxa
crew_archetypes.flavor: As part of the “ancient ritual” of the gik'tal, Jaxa must defend herself against an opponent while blindfolded.

crew_archetypes.name: Sarin
crew_archetypes.flavor: Disillusioned with the Cabal’s activities, Sarin created her own resistance movement.

action.name: The Price Of Evolution Was Too High
My People Will Find Your Ship

crew_archetypes.name: Sahil
crew_archetypes.flavor: After forty years of dutiful isolation, Sahil is commissioned as a Federation communications officer.

action.name: It Would Be My Honor to Assist You

crew_archetypes.name: Lieutenant Sahil
crew_archetypes.flavor: Officially commissioned as a lieutenant, Sahil’s  dedication to upholding the ideals of the United Federation of Planets is recognized.

action.name: You Must Remember We Are With You

crew_archetypes.name: Underwear Larkin
crew_archetypes.flavor: Larkin steps out of his quarters in his underwear to witness the consequences of his unauthorized experiments with tribbles.

crew_archetypes.name: Kurak
crew_archetypes.flavor: An expert in warp field theory, Kurak attended Doctor Reyga's metaphasic shield test aboard the Enterprise-D.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Klaa
crew_archetypes.flavor: Eager to gain fame by defeating Kirk, Captain Klaa engaged the Enterprise-A at Nimbus III.

crew_archetypes.name: Grecian Carolyn Palamas
crew_archetypes.flavor: The object of Apollo's affections, Palamas must choose between her crew and the will of a so-called god.

crew_archetypes.name: Ezral
crew_archetypes.flavor: After the ship crashed, Ezral created a holographic team for himself and his daughter to provide them with companionship.

action.name: I've Made All The Friends I Need

crew_archetypes.name: CMO 'Bones' McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise, Leonard McCoy was a close friend of Captain Kirk.

crew_archetypes.name: Prisoner 'Bones' McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sentenced to a life of hard labor on the asteroid Rura Penthe, McCoy was rescued by Kirk and Spock.

crew_archetypes.name: "Dark Ages" McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: McCoy infiltrated a 1980s San Francisco hospital to rescue a gravely-wounded Chekov.

crew_archetypes.name: Drafted McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: Having already retired from Starfleet, Doctor McCoy was incensed to be called up during the V'ger crisis.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: Donning an environmental suit and boarding the U.S.S. Defiant with his crewmates, McCoy seeks to find out what happened to its ill-fated crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: A doctor from the Mirror Universe, McCoy possesses all sorts of devices for torture and interrogation.

crew_archetypes.name: Mint Julep McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leonard McCoy is a big fan of mint juleps and sometimes he prepares one or two to relax.

crew_archetypes.name: Tribble McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: McCoy suggests an easy solution to the tribble overbreeding problem - quit feeding them.

crew_archetypes.name: Frantic McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: Doctor McCoy is not happy with Commodore Decker’s decision to attack the Doomsday Machine.

crew_archetypes.name: Base Camp McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: McCoy is not very happy with the way Kirk has chosen to spend his vacation and considers climbing the mountain to be an irresponsible act.

crew_archetypes.name: Admiral McCoy
crew_archetypes.flavor: Admiral McCoy was invited to examine the medical layout of the USS Enterprise-D, after which Data escorted him to the USS Hood.

action.name: You Treat Her Like A Lady... And She'll Always Bring You Home

crew_archetypes.name: McCoy in Command
crew_archetypes.flavor: Did McCoy ever imagine that he would one day be in the captain’s chair? Hardly. Does he like it? Not 100% sure.

action.name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Captain!
It Will Pass. You'll See. It Will Pass.

crew_archetypes.name: Edith Keeler
crew_archetypes.flavor: Edith administered a New York mission, near where Kirk was forced to allow her to die in traffic to preserve his timeline.

crew_archetypes.name: Ulis
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the Ferengi pirates who infiltrated the USS Enterprise to plunder it. However, the pirates’ greed would be their downfall.

crew_archetypes.name: First Maje Culluh
crew_archetypes.flavor: First Maje of the Kazon-Nistrim, Culluh succeeded in capturing U.S.S. Voyager for a short time.

crew_archetypes.name: Persis
crew_archetypes.flavor: A human augment, Persis developed a strong attachment to Arik Soong, who she viewed as her father.

crew_archetypes.name: Lieutenant Valeris
crew_archetypes.flavor: Spock's intended successor, Lieutenant Valeris provided Kirk's logs to be used against him at trial.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Sam Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kirk joins a landing party to study a strange comet and prevent it from colliding with Persephone III

crew_archetypes.name: Valeo Beta V Sam Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: As part of the landing party, Sam went to Valeo Beta V to find out what happened to the USS Peregrine.

action.name: We Need To Alert The Rest Of The Crew

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Sam Kirk
crew_archetypes.flavor: Starfleet officer, xenoanthropologist, who spends a lot of time in his laboratory

crew_archetypes.name: Technician Fisher
crew_archetypes.flavor: A geologist and senior science officer who served under both Pike and Kirk aboard the Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: Mot
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Bolian barber who works aboard the USS Enterprise. His tactical advice has come in handy more than once.

crew_archetypes.name: Mestral
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Vulcan who was so fascinated with humans that he would risk his life for them. Ultimately he chose to live among them.

action.name: I'm Willing To Take the Risk.

crew_archetypes.name: Zho'Kaan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Stuck on a moon with Tucker, Zho’Kaan must figure out how to communicate with him so they can work together to escape.

crew_archetypes.name: General Chang
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief of Staff to Chancellor Gorkon, Chang conspired to bring about a Klingon-Federation war.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Robert DeSoto
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the USS Hood, DeSoto delivers a sensitive mission and specialist to the “Galaxy boys” aboard the Enterprise.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Sato
crew_archetypes.flavor: Comm Officer onboard the Enterprise, Hoshi Sato's experiences led her to create a universal linguacode.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Empress Sato
crew_archetypes.flavor: After taking over the Defiant in the mirror universe, Sato proclaimed herself Empress of the Terran Empire.

crew_archetypes.name: Tribble Sato
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sato takes kindly to first contact with a friendly Tribble under the care of Dr. Phlox.

crew_archetypes.name: Tourist Hoshi Sato
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hoshi enjoys learning the language of the places she visits. And she fascinates a Risan couple by learning their language and being able to keep up the conversation.

action.name: Na. No. How Am I Doing?

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Hoshi Sato
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hoshi takes part in her first away mission and has to overcome her own fears and doubts.

action.name: Well, I Just, I Bit My Lip And Got Through It
Do You Know Who I Am?

crew_archetypes.name: Shiboline M'Ress
crew_archetypes.flavor: A natural communicator, M’Ress worked as a relief communications officer under Captain Kirk.

crew_archetypes.name: Dream Alien Leader
crew_archetypes.flavor: The leader of a group of armed aliens who drew the Voyager crew into ceaseless nightmares.

action.name: As Long As You're Asleep, You're No Threat To Us

crew_archetypes.name: Humanoid Figure
crew_archetypes.flavor: Unable to appear physically, the elusive humanoid figure attempts to manipulate affairs from the distant 28th century.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain John Harriman
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the Enterpise-B, Harriman's first mission was to rescue El-Aurian refugee ships from the Nexus.

crew_archetypes.name: Amanda Cole
crew_archetypes.flavor: Amanda was assigned to the Enterprise where she took part in resolving the Xindi incident.

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Dathon
crew_archetypes.flavor: Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel.

crew_archetypes.name: Tactical Stamets
crew_archetypes.flavor: Stamets, having connected the Discovery to the spore drive, jumps partially into the mycelial network to recover Tilly and May.

crew_archetypes.name: Li Nalas
crew_archetypes.flavor: The leader of one of Bajor's many resistance cells during the Cardassian Occupation of Bajor

action.name: Is there Any Way I Can Help?

crew_archetypes.name: Pel
crew_archetypes.flavor: Pel disguised herself as a male and displayed great business acumen to fight the notion that females can't earn profit.

crew_archetypes.name: Yeoman Leslie Thompson
crew_archetypes.flavor: Leslie became a victim of the Kelvan leaders when she fought him to prove her strength.

action.name: What Kind of People Are They?

crew_archetypes.name: Miranda Jones
crew_archetypes.flavor: Having studied on Vulcan for many years, Dr. Miranda Jones gained control of her telepathic abilities. Born blind she is immune to the affects of the Medusans, whose ambassador she accompanies aboard the Enterprise.

action.name: Violent Emotion is a Kind of Insanity

crew_archetypes.name: Princess Tonia Barrows
crew_archetypes.flavor: During her time with McCoy on shore leave, Barrows thinks of wearing a fairy-tale princess dress which somehow instantly materializes.

action.name: A Princess of the Blood Royale

crew_archetypes.name: Yeoman Barrows
crew_archetypes.flavor: Yeoman Barrows was one of the members of a group that became trapped on the shore leave planet.

action.name: It Is Beautiful. So Lovely, And Restful

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Ron Docent
crew_archetypes.flavor: His work on the U.S.S. Vancouver has left him exhausted from all the epic adventures. Now he just wants a simpler life on a smaller ship.

action.name: Do I Need To Remind You Who My Grandma’s Neighbor Was?
I Am Not Afraid, Just Very Tired

crew_archetypes.name: Logician Solok
crew_archetypes.flavor: In order to instigate a negative emotional response, Solok uses the sport of baseball to try and embarrass Sisko.

action.name: I Fail to See Why You Are Celebrating

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Solok
crew_archetypes.flavor: When reuniting with an old colleague, Captain Solok seeks to repair his ship and provoke an emotional response through competition.

crew_archetypes.name: DaiMon Solok
crew_archetypes.flavor: Hired by Picard, Solok smuggled Picard and his team through Cardassian controlled territory.

action.name: When do you want to leave?

crew_archetypes.name: Adam
crew_archetypes.flavor: From a group looking for the planet Eden, Adam sought to persuade others through song.

crew_archetypes.name: Assimilated Esmar
crew_archetypes.flavor: After the assimilation of Starfleet’s youngest, Esmar took control of the USS Titan.

crew_archetypes.name: Keevan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Survivor of a ship crash, Keevan ordered his Jem'Hadar to their deaths and then surrendered to Captain Sisko.

crew_archetypes.name: Badge-Challenged Linus
crew_archetypes.flavor: Linus is having more trouble than most crew members learning to use a personal transporter.

crew_archetypes.name: Grand Nagus Zek
crew_archetypes.flavor: As Grand Nagus of the Ferengi, Zek was the head of the Ferengi government.

crew_archetypes.name: Federation President Rillak
crew_archetypes.flavor: With the reinvigoration of the Federation, Rillak addresses the first class of Starfleet cadets in over a century.

action.name: It’s A Lot to Live Up To. No Pressure

crew_archetypes.name: Punk Rocker
crew_archetypes.flavor: A man simply enjoying music on the bus before Spock puts an end to his unkind outbursts.

crew_archetypes.name: Brunt, F.C.A.
crew_archetypes.flavor: Liquidator Brunt of the Ferengi Commerce Authority is often called in to handle any suspect behavior from Quark and his family.

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Ogawa
crew_archetypes.flavor: Head nurse of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, Alyssa Ogawa was essential to Doctor Crusher's medical staff.

crew_archetypes.name: Lieutenant Ogawa
crew_archetypes.flavor: During the Borg attack, Ogawa helped evacuate casualties from the Enterprise-E infirmary.

crew_archetypes.name: Torchbearer Rejac
crew_archetypes.flavor: Guardian of the Beacon of Kahless.

crew_archetypes.name: Pascal Fullerton
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chairman of the New Essentialist Movement, Pascal is determined to “restore the moral traditions” of the Federation.

crew_archetypes.name: All-in Owosekun
crew_archetypes.flavor: Owosekun was picked for this mission because of her raw determination to act, which she shows again in the fighting ring with a knockout.

crew_archetypes.name: Century Guinan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Guinan, contemporary to this time period, meets Picard for the “first” time as he tries to prevent Data’s murder.

crew_archetypes.name: Young Guinan
crew_archetypes.flavor: The sight of a familiar face gives Picard a spark of hope, but Guinan hasn’t yet encountered him and wants no part of whatever he is into.

crew_archetypes.name: Festive Guinan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Together with everyone else, Guinan celebrates the wedding of Riker and Troi, and also talks about her own past and future marriages.

crew_archetypes.name: Deela
crew_archetypes.flavor: Deela is queen of the Scalosians. She falls for Kirk and, due to Scalosian male infertility, seeks to use the male crew of the Enterprise to continue their species.

action.name: We Move In The Wink Of An Eye

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Tucker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief Engineer aboard the NX-01 Enterprise, Tucker remained a hands-on officer unafraid of a little elbow grease.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Tucker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief Engineer of the I.S.S Enterprise, Tucker was able to prevent the U.S.S. Defiant from being lost to sabotage.

crew_archetypes.name: Geskana Tucker
crew_archetypes.flavor: After helping a stranded Ship, Archer and Trip test their mettle in an alien sport.

crew_archetypes.name: Mutinous Trip Tucker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tucker confronts Archer when he, infected with an insectoid, begins to make strange and sometimes dangerous decisions for the crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Pregnant Trip Tucker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tucker was faced with the fact that if you play a ‘game’ on an alien ship, you can not only have fun, but also get pregnant.

crew_archetypes.name: Desert Trip Tucker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Lured to an alien world and pulled into a power struggle, Tucker and Archer are forced to wander under the scorching sun, awaiting rescue.

action.name: It's Hotter Than Hell Out There

crew_archetypes.name: Dawn Trip Tucker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Tucker's shuttle tests end in disaster - he is attacked by a hostile alien, forcing him to land on a desert planet.

action.name: What The Hell Are You Doing? Are You Crazy?

crew_archetypes.name: Transporter Chief Kyle
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kyle is very kind, even to those who take aim at him in the middle of the night.

crew_archetypes.name: "Bullseye" Kyle
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kyle, transporter chief on the Enterprise, uses the device for an unintended purpose: beaming a gene therapy salve right into Spock’s eye.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Kruge
crew_archetypes.flavor: Skipper of a bird-of-prey, Commander Kruge sought to weaponize the Genesis device for the Klingons.

crew_archetypes.name: Motura
crew_archetypes.flavor: A Vidiian sculptor suffering from the Phage who needed a lung transplant to save his life.

action.name: There Is No Other Way For Us To Survive

crew_archetypes.name: Miral Torres
crew_archetypes.flavor: Miral appeared on the Barge of the Dead to her daughter, B'Elanna, during a near-death vision.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Jennifer Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: A scientist for the KCA, Jennifer was recruited by the Terran Rebellion by prime universe Ben Sisko.

crew_archetypes.name: Jennifer Sisko
crew_archetypes.flavor: Jennifer may be gone, but she is still a part of Ben’s existence.

crew_archetypes.name: Vedek Winn Adami
crew_archetypes.flavor: An outspoken member of the Vedek Assembly, Winn was a prominent member of the Bajoran theology.

crew_archetypes.name: Rogue Kai Winn
crew_archetypes.flavor: Embittered by feeling overshadowed by the Emissary, Kai Winn turned to the forbidden Kosst Amojen and Pah-Wraiths.

crew_archetypes.name: Kai Winn
crew_archetypes.flavor: After the Cardassian occupation, Winn became the first new kai, and her electoral victory was accepted as the 'Will of the Prophets'.

action.name: Honor The Prophets And They Will Always Love You

crew_archetypes.name: Croden
crew_archetypes.flavor: The male Rakhari resisted and fled the government that killed his wives. He tried to save his daughter, though not through the most honest of means.

action.name: Sometimes I Do Tell The Truth

crew_archetypes.name: Resistance Shakaar
crew_archetypes.flavor: A part of the resistance during the Cardassian Occupation, Shakaar was later First Minister of Bajor.

crew_archetypes.name: Colonel Grat
crew_archetypes.flavor: This Tandaran officer has no intention of letting Captain Archer leap away - not when he might have intel on the Cabal.

action.name: Your Curiosity Almost Got You Killed

crew_archetypes.name: Grilka
crew_archetypes.flavor: Grilka, head of the House of Grilka, married Quark in a gambit to keep her house upon the death of her husband.

crew_archetypes.name: Rurigan
crew_archetypes.flavor: Male Yaderan who lived on Yadera Prime until it was conquered. Then he created a holographic recreation of his lost village.

action.name: And How Do You Plan To Do That?

crew_archetypes.name: Human Silik
crew_archetypes.flavor: In human form, Silik teams up with Archer after traveling back in time to find schematics for the temporal conduit.

action.name: I'd Come To Believe Your Race Was Inherently… Unaggressive

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Bryce
crew_archetypes.flavor: Being promoted to Lieutenant Commander means an increase in duties for Bryce. Will he find time to kitesurf with his new responsibilities?

action.name: I Used to Kitesurf the Biggest Waves on Manark IV

crew_archetypes.name: Altan Inigo Soong
crew_archetypes.flavor: Working with Sutra, Soong built a beacon to contact the protectors of synthetic life for the creations he considered his children.

action.name: I Suppose That's What Mothers Do

crew_archetypes.name: Yeoman Martha Landon
crew_archetypes.flavor: An engineer skilled in hand-to-hand combat. Her display of affection for Chekov angered the Vaalians, forcing her to put her skills to use.

action.name: Love Is When Two People Are...

crew_archetypes.name: Lt. Commander Jack Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: Part of the crew of the U.S.S. Stargazer, Lieutenant Commander Crusher was killed in an accident on an away mission.

crew_archetypes.name: Vox
crew_archetypes.flavor: Thanks to his father, Jack Crusher was able to free himself from the Collective and escape.

action.name: The Time Of The Borg Is Over!

crew_archetypes.name: Rogue Jack Crusher
crew_archetypes.flavor: The son of two Starfleet veterans, Jack chose a different path. He conducts criminal activities and is wanted under various aliases.

crew_archetypes.name: Dr. Phlox
crew_archetypes.flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the Enterprise, Phlox was a lifelong learner of every medical art.

crew_archetypes.name: Mirror Phlox
crew_archetypes.flavor: A sadistic doctor serving on board the I.S.S Enterprise, a starship from the mirror universe.

action.name: I'm A Physician, Not An Engineer!

crew_archetypes.name: Nanoprobe Phlox
crew_archetypes.flavor: After being infected with Borgs Nanoprobes, Phlox needs to think more like an Engineer than a Doctor to cure his condition.

crew_archetypes.name: EV Suit Phlox
crew_archetypes.flavor: Even Phlox has to engage in regular EV suit training.

crew_archetypes.name: Tribble Phlox
crew_archetypes.flavor: Phlox brings a small number of tribbles aboard Enterprise NX-01 as an easily sustainable food source for his pets.

crew_archetypes.name: Starfleet Medical Phlox
crew_archetypes.flavor: Doctor Phlox is busy treating Klaang, who was injured by the Plasma Cannon.

action.name: I'll Do The Best I Can

crew_archetypes.name: Anbo-jyutsu Kyle Riker
crew_archetypes.flavor: Kyle engages in an anbo-jyutsu duel with his son Will, during which the two manage to talk about their differences and end a years-long conflict.

crew_archetypes.name: Judge Advocate Prosecutor Batel
crew_archetypes.flavor: At the tribunal in the Chin-Riley case, Batel served as prosecutor - reluctantly.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Barak
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the K'tinga-class I.K.S Amar, Barak and his ship were destroyed by V'ger.

crew_archetypes.name: Cosmo Traitt
crew_archetypes.flavor: After Cleveland Booker stole his cargo, Traitt tirelessly tracks him down to finish his delivery job.

action.name: The Best Runner in the Quadrant

crew_archetypes.name: Stonn
crew_archetypes.flavor: T’Pring's colleague at work at the El-Kestanktil. Stonn is in love with her and is even ready to duel with Spock to become T’Pring's fiancé.

action.name: Got To Say, You Are Very Attractive For A Prison Guard

crew_archetypes.name: Holodeck 3 Dr. Brahms
crew_archetypes.flavor: A holographic representation of Enterprise-D warp system designer Doctor Leah Brahms.

crew_archetypes.name: Counselor Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ship's counselor on the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, her empathic abilities were invaluable to the crew.

crew_archetypes.name: Rakal Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Disguised as Major Rakal of the Tal Shiar, Troi was tasked with helping Romulans defect to the Federation.

crew_archetypes.name: Commander Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Stranded on Earth in the 21st century, Troi helped convince Cochrane to take his historic flight.

crew_archetypes.name: Bridge Officer Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Troi received a promotion to a full commander after passing the Bridge Officer's Test.

crew_archetypes.name: Goddess of Empathy Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Ship's counselor Deanna Troi was envisioned as the Goddess of Empathy in a holodeck program of Reginald Barclay's.

crew_archetypes.name: Durango Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: A fan of the 'Ancient West' since childhood, Deanna played the role of Durango in the Deadwood holoprogram.

crew_archetypes.name: Nepenthe Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Using her experience as both counselor and mother, Troi reaches out to Soji and advises Picard on Nepenthe.

crew_archetypes.name: Bridal Deanna Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: Celebrating their marriage, Deanna enjoys the festivities of her human heritage with a traditional reception.

crew_archetypes.name: Night Terrors Troi
crew_archetypes.flavor: After the Enterprise finds itself drifting through a space-time anomaly, Troi becomes the only crew member who can still dream. But those dreams are nightmares during which she may not be alone.

crew_archetypes.name: Talosian Keeper
crew_archetypes.flavor: The Talosian Keeper proves to be the only one capable of healing the fracture in Spock’s mind, but only at a personal cost to Burnham.

action.name: Material Illusion Is Our Primary Form Of Defense

crew_archetypes.name: Master Surchid Falow
crew_archetypes.flavor: Representing the Wadi, Falow enjoys sharing parts of their culture with the Federation, like their complex and intricate table games.

action.name: Double The Peril, Double Your Winnings
We Are A Long Way From Home

crew_archetypes.name: Abraham Lincoln
crew_archetypes.flavor: A simulacrum of the late President, created by the Excalbians to examine the difference between good and evil.

action.name: At the Tip of My Blade

crew_archetypes.name: Captain Kasidy Yates
crew_archetypes.flavor: Captain of the civilian freighter 'Xhosa', Kasidy was briefly imprisoned for smuggling Maquis cargo.

crew_archetypes.name: Smuggler Kasidy Yates
crew_archetypes.flavor: Sympathetic to the Maquis, Kasidy helped Michael Eddington smuggle replicators away from the Cardassians.

action.name: Let's See If You Can Beat That

crew_archetypes.name: Bride Kasidy Danielle Yates
crew_archetypes.flavor: Against the wish of the prophets, Kasidy marries Benjamin Sisko.

action.name: Well, That Almost Sounds Like A Threat

crew_archetypes.name: Cassie
crew_archetypes.flavor: Benny Russell's single-minded fiancée, who was willing to buy out the diner so she and Benny could settle down and finally start a family.

action.name: It's All Right, It's All Right. I'm With You.

crew_archetypes.name: The Preacher
crew_archetypes.flavor: A preacher appearing in Sisko’s visions of Benny Russell. His cryptic words hinted at something beyond the surface.

action.name: Go Now And Write The Truth

crew_archetypes.name: Ensign Vorik
crew_archetypes.flavor: An engineering officer aboard Voyager, Vorik was part of the team that developed the Delta Flyer.

crew_archetypes.name: Zhaban
crew_archetypes.flavor: A former Tal Shiar agent, Zhaban is now a housekeeper for Picard, and his wisdom may be the greatest thing he can offer the former officer.

crew_archetypes.name: Melora Pazlar
crew_archetypes.flavor: One of the only handful of Elaysians to have left their homeworld, Melora wishes to explore the stars without giving up being herself.

crew_archetypes.name: Nel Apgar
crew_archetypes.flavor: With the early arrival of the Enterprise, Apgar attempts to misdirect an investigation into his secretly completed project.

ship_archetypes.name: Maquis Raider
ship_archetypes.flavor: A small and manueverable ship, favored by the Maquis for quick escapes and durability under hostile pursuit.

ship_archetypes.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship_archetypes.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

ship_archetypes.name: Nova Class
ship_archetypes.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

ship_archetypes.name: Jem'Hadar Fighter
ship_archetypes.flavor: A warship used by the soldier species of the Dominion. Equipped with phased polaron beam weapons

ship_archetypes.name: Val Jean
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

ship_archetypes.name: Hirogen Hunter Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: Small but heavily-armed, these vessels are equipped to allow for efficient hunting and processing of game.

ship_archetypes.name: Borg Sphere
ship_archetypes.flavor: Borg spheres were primarily scout and long-range tactical vessels. Borg cubes sometimes housed Borg spheres as auxillary craft.

ship_archetypes.name: Suurok Class Combat Cruiser
ship_archetypes.flavor: Used as both a Combat Cruiser or a Science Vessel, the Suurok Class was among the fastest and most powerful starships operating in the Vulcan fleet.

ship_archetypes.name: Miranda Class Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: Miranda Class

ship_archetypes.name: Romulan Valdore-type Warbird
ship_archetypes.flavor: Valdore-type Warbird

ship_archetypes.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

ship_archetypes.name: Defiant-Class Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: Named after the initial prototype, brought into production during the Dominion War to serve as warships.

ship_archetypes.name: Intrepid-Class Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

ship_archetypes.name: Constitution Class Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: The face of Starfleet in the 23rd century, these heavy cruisers were designed for long-term missions.

ship_archetypes.name: Cardassian Galor Cruiser
ship_archetypes.flavor: The "foot soldier" of the Cardassian Union, nimble and destructive. Features multiple phaser arrays.

ship_archetypes.name: Ferengi D'Kora Marauder
ship_archetypes.flavor: An enigmatic vessel used for battle and transport. Capable of disabling a deflector shield.

ship_archetypes.name: NX-Class Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: The first Starfleet ships to be equipped with warp five engines, allowing exploration beyond neighboring star systems.

ship_archetypes.name: Klingon K't'inga Battlecruiser
ship_archetypes.flavor: A follow up to the powerful D7 Battlecruiser, the K't'inga Class was the primary warship of the Klingon Empire in the late 23rd century.

ship_archetypes.name: Terran Empire Constellation Class
ship_archetypes.flavor: The Constellation Class was a Terran Empire Battle Cruiser that entered service in the late 23rd century.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-D
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Galaxy-class vessel famously commanded by Captain Picard. Allows for saucer separation in emergency situations.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Constitution-class vessel made legend under the command of Captain Kirk. A hardy ship that survived many encounters.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Defiant
ship_archetypes.flavor: Initially created for use against the Borg. Equipped with ablative armor and Starfleet's first legal cloaking device.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Voyager
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Intrepid-class vessel notable for being the first to explore the Delta Quadrant--if not by choice.

ship_archetypes.name: Romulan D'deridex Warbird
ship_archetypes.flavor: One of the largest and most advanced vessels in the quadrant. Utilizes a forced quantum singularity as a power source.

ship_archetypes.name: Hirogen Warship
ship_archetypes.flavor: Small but heavily-armed, these vessels are equipped to allow for efficient hunting and processing of game.

ship_archetypes.name: Borg Sphere 878
ship_archetypes.flavor: Commandeered by General Kotok and other rebel Borg members of Unimatrix Zero in 2377.

ship_archetypes.name: I.S.S. Avenger
ship_archetypes.flavor: Registered NX-09, the I.S.S Avenger NX-Class Battleship served alongside the I.S.S. Enterprise in the 22nd Century. It met its demise at the hands of the U.S.S Defiant.

ship_archetypes.name: La Sirena
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Kaplan F17 Speed Freighter for hire, captained by Rios. Supplemented with a variety of Holoprograms to assist across a variety of dangerous emergency situations.

ship_archetypes.name: Tholian Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: Equipped with an energy-dampener and the ability to create the infamous Tholian web, a near impenetrable tractor field.

ship_archetypes.name: Generational NX-01 Enterprise
ship_archetypes.flavor: Finding themselves stranded in the 21st century, the Enterprise crew embarked on a multi-generational journey to prevent their past from yet again becoming the Enterprise's future.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. T'Kumbra
ship_archetypes.flavor: Commanded by the decorated Captain Solok, this all-Vulcan crewed Nebula-class was at the front lines of the Dominion War.

ship_archetypes.name: Harrad-Sar's Barge
ship_archetypes.flavor: While pretending to command a mining vessel, Harrad-Sar launched an operation to seize control of the Enterprise and deliver it into Orion hands.

ship_archetypes.name: Malon Export Vessel
ship_archetypes.flavor: A volatile waste transport ship with a notoriously low life expectancy for its crew.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Yeager
ship_archetypes.flavor: During the Dominion War this light cruiser was often used to protect Deep Space Nine.

ship_archetypes.name: Karemma Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: A vessel used by the Karemma, a Gamma Quadrant species and part of the Dominion. Equipped with unique defense and attack systems.

ship_archetypes.name: Gorn Raider
ship_archetypes.flavor: Gorn Raiders were ships belonging to the Gorn Hegemony equipped with weapons said to be more powerful than phasers.

ship_archetypes.name: Kovaalan Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: Small, nimble ships that attacked the Enterprise during its attempt to cut through a subspace corridor to reach the homeworld of the Xindi Council.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Vancouver
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Parliament-class engineering ship shouldered with a surprising amount of epic missions. Too many, according to one crew member.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Thunderchild
ship_archetypes.flavor: This 24th century Akira-class ship incorporates a multitude of tactical systems mainly focused on battle scenarios. In the wrong hands, it could be a deadly weapon.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Cochrane
ship_archetypes.flavor: With a history of transporting some of Starfleet’s finest, the U.S.S. Cochrane was put to the test battling in the Dominion War.

ship_archetypes.name: Arctic One
ship_archetypes.flavor: Borg assimilated ship equipped with cutting beams and proton weapons.

ship_archetypes.name: The Dove
ship_archetypes.flavor: The Dove, a top spot for rest and recovery, is where the Cerritos engineers are sent to recuperate.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Farragut
ship_archetypes.flavor: In alternate timeline, U.S.S. Farragut took part in the battle with the Bird-of-Prey after Captain Kirk responded to a distress call from Outpost 4.

ship_archetypes.name: Vidiian Warship
ship_archetypes.flavor: A warship utilized by the Vidiians loaded with heavy weaponry.

ship_archetypes.name: Tsunkatse Vessel
ship_archetypes.flavor: Penk’s starship that was used as the main base for a live spectacle of Tsunkatse matches.

ship_archetypes.name: I.S.S. Buran
ship_archetypes.flavor: Gabriel Lorca’s Cardenas-class starship that was destroyed by Emperor Philippa Georgiou.

ship_archetypes.name: Borg Cube
ship_archetypes.flavor: A smaller version of the Collective's ubiquitous and fearsome cubical spacecraft. Features self-repairing systems.

ship_archetypes.name: H.M.S. Bounty
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Klingon bird-of-prey commandeered by Admiral James T. Kirk. Ironically named Bounty by CMO Leonard "Bones" McCoy.

ship_archetypes.name: I.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Constitution-class vessel made legend under the command of Captain Kirk. A hardy ship that survived many encounters.

ship_archetypes.name: D'Kora Krayton
ship_archetypes.flavor: An enigmatic vessel used for battle and transport. Capable of disabling a deflector shield.

ship_archetypes.name: Prakesh
ship_archetypes.flavor: Gul Dukat's Galor Class vessel, famed for its service in the Klingon-Cardassian War.

ship_archetypes.name: NX-01 Enterprise
ship_archetypes.flavor: The flagship of United Earth Starfleet, pivotal in founding the Coalition of Planets, a precursor to the UFP.

ship_archetypes.name: IKS T'Ong
ship_archetypes.flavor: A K't'inga Class Klingon Battlecruiser, the I.K.S T'Ong gained fame while on a crucial mission under the command of Captain K'Temoc.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Shenzhou
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Walker-class vessel involved in the Battle at the Binary Stars. Ship motto - 'All existing things are really one.'

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Discovery
ship_archetypes.flavor: A pioneering science vessel, the crew of U.S.S. Discovery developed a method to safely traverse great distances in an instant with her spore drive.

ship_archetypes.name: Klingon Sarcophagus
ship_archetypes.flavor: Flagship of the House of T'Kuvma, the Sarcophagus was armored by thousands of caskets containing remains of Klingon warriors known as the 'Black Fleet'.

ship_archetypes.name: I.S.S. Defiant
ship_archetypes.flavor: Based on plans taken from the Prime Universe, the I.S.S. Defiant was built and commanded by Mirror 'Smiley' O'Brien to lead the insurgency against Regent Worf.

ship_archetypes.name: Andorian Battlecruiser Kumari
ship_archetypes.flavor: A first of its kind Andorian Battlecruiser named after the first ice-cutter to circumnavigate Andoria.

ship_archetypes.name: Orion Syndicate Interceptor
ship_archetypes.flavor: A moderately armed ship used by the Orion Syndicate.

ship_archetypes.name: Ni'Var
ship_archetypes.flavor: The Ni'Var was sent by Vulcan High Command to transfer Subcommander T'Pol after her involvement in the destruction of the Vulcan Monastery on P'Jem.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Reliant
ship_archetypes.flavor: U.S.S Reliant

ship_archetypes.name: The Valdore
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Valdore-type Romulan Warbird, The Valdore battled alongside the U.S.S. Enterprise against the Reman warbird the Scimitar at the battle in the Bassen Rift.

ship_archetypes.name: Captain Proton Rocket Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: The heroic Captain Proton uses this heavily-armed rocket ship to defend Earth against dastardly villains!

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-A
ship_archetypes.flavor: The second Federation ship to bear the name "Enterprise," this Constitution-class vessel is equipped with improved tactical modifications and boasts a powerful warp core drive.

ship_archetypes.name: Xindi-Insectoid Patrol Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: This small starship used by the Xindi-Insectoids is equipped with multiple directed energy-weapon emitters. As a Patrol ship, it is best known for its speed and maneuverability.

ship_archetypes.name: The Scimitar
ship_archetypes.flavor: A heavily-armed warship constructed by Shinzon for the sole purpose of overthrowing the Romulan Empire.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-E
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Sovereign-class starship, which, after defeating a Borg Cube, went back in time to prevent the Borg from interfering with humanity's first contact with the Vulcans.

ship_archetypes.name: Cardassian Keldon Class
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Cardassian warship used during the 24th century, some of which were secretly enhanced with cloaking under the Obsidian Order and the Romulan Tal Shiar.

ship_archetypes.name: Assimilated Voyager
ship_archetypes.flavor: After an attack from a Species 8472 vessel, the Borg Cube defends the Voyager. Janeway agrees to a temporary alliance with the Borg, beginning with the Voyager's assimilation.

ship_archetypes.name: Federation Fighter
ship_archetypes.flavor: The cutting edge Federation Fighter first saw major action in the battle against Control at Xahea.

ship_archetypes.name: The Artifact
ship_archetypes.flavor: This Borg vessel is severed from the Collective and hosted both research and rehabilitation for xBs. Now active, its queencell, Borg population, and repair systems are engaged.

ship_archetypes.name: Krenim Weapon Ship
ship_archetypes.flavor: Developed by Annorax to remove threats to the Krenim Empire via manipulation of the space-time continuum.

ship_archetypes.name: IKS Negh'Var
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Klingon warship commanded by General Martok. It spearheaded an attack on Deep Space Nine, an act which dissolved the Federation-Klingon alliance.

ship_archetypes.name: Borg Queen's Vessel
ship_archetypes.flavor: The Borg utilize this vessel to transport the Borg Queen within a shielded chamber that is still capable of immense destruction on the vanguard of assimilation efforts.

ship_archetypes.name: Warship Voyager
ship_archetypes.flavor: According to the Kyrian Heritage, this warship commanded by the brutal Captain Janeway terrorized the Kyrian people with biogenic weapons.

ship_archetypes.name: I.S.S. Discovery
ship_archetypes.flavor: Captained by the fearsome Sylvia "Killy" Tilly, the I.S.S. Discovery was destroyed by Klingon forces upon arrival in the prime universe.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Prometheus
ship_archetypes.flavor: This prototypal Federation ship's experimental assault modes and warp factor 9.99 capability made it a priority target for Romulan hijackers.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Excelsior
ship_archetypes.flavor: The first Starfleet vessel to be fitted with a transwarp drive, the Excelsior was later commanded by Captain Sulu.

ship_archetypes.name: Xindi-Aquatic Cruiser
ship_archetypes.flavor: This sleek hydrodynamic starship is the largest and most advanced ship of any of the various Xindi species.

ship_archetypes.name: NX-02 Columbia
ship_archetypes.flavor: Commanded by Captain Hernandez, the second NX-Class ship featured a warp five engine with improved hull plating and a changed weapon loadout compared to its predecessor.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Glenn
ship_archetypes.flavor: Sister ship to the U.S.S. Discovery, the crew of the Glenn took greater risks in order to develop their spore drive more quickly, which would eventually prove disastrous.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Roddenberry
ship_archetypes.flavor: This timeless style of ship still finds service in the Federation, providing valuable lessons and experiences to crew members new and old.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Raven
ship_archetypes.flavor: This Raven-type exploration vessel carried Magnus and Erin Hansen with their daughter Annika - the first humans to make contact with the Borg.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Phoenix
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Nebula-class vessel commanded by Captain Maxwell who turned vigilante destroying a Cardassian outpost and several ships in Sector 21505.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Hiawatha
ship_archetypes.flavor: A 23rd century medical frigate that was lost during the Federation-Klingon War.

ship_archetypes.name: Romulan Bird-of-Prey
ship_archetypes.flavor: With an avian-inspired design, this vessel was in use by the Romulan military during the 23rd century.

ship_archetypes.name: IKS Bortas
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Klingon Battlecruiser that was Chancellor Gowron's flagship during the Klingon Civil War. Was the primary warship of the Klingons.

ship_archetypes.name: Gomtuu
ship_archetypes.flavor: As a sentient organic creature, Gomtuu exists as a cosmic vessel. After the death of its crew, it wandered through space, seeking to assuage its loneliness.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Constellation NCC-1017
ship_archetypes.flavor: Captained by Commodore Matt Decker, the U.S.S. Constellation NCC-1017 was the first Federation ship to encounter the dreaded Doomsday Machine.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Cerritos
ship_archetypes.flavor: The U.S.S. Cerritos is a California-class engineering and operations support cruiser that endured many perilous events, but kept going, against all odds.

ship_archetypes.name: Sikarian Vessel
ship_archetypes.flavor: There is little to be known about the technology surrounding this vessel due to the secretiveness of the Sikarians. Their Canon of Laws simply forbid sharing their knowledge.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Le Guin
ship_archetypes.flavor: This 32nd century starship, registered as NCC-325060, is the peak of technology and one of the best scout vessels available to the Federation.

ship_archetypes.name: NX-01 Refit
ship_archetypes.flavor: After years of dealing with unknowns, The NX-01 was refitted with major upgrades based on everything learned throughout its adventures.

ship_archetypes.name: The Serene Squall
ship_archetypes.flavor: The Serene Squall was a pirate ship captained by Angel, who carried out their intricate plan to capture the Enterprise.

ship_archetypes.name: R'ongovian Flagship
ship_archetypes.flavor: A solar sailship used by the R'ongovian Protectorate for ceremonial occasions.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-J
ship_archetypes.flavor: The ship took part in the Battle of Procyon V and successfully attacked  Sphere-Builders  so they were forced into interdimensional space.

ship_archetypes.name: The Shrike
ship_archetypes.flavor: Captained by the Changeling Vadic, The Shrike was a formidable warship loaded with all kinds of devastating weaponry.

ship_archetypes.name: Gorn Destroyer
ship_archetypes.flavor: A powerful Gorn vessel of intimidating size armed with plasma cannons and the flexibility to function within a planet's atmosphere as well as out.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-C
ship_archetypes.flavor: An Ambassador-class ship that played the key role in securing a Treaty of Alliance between the Klingon Empire and the Federation.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Yang
ship_archetypes.flavor: This Friendship-class starship was a part of the flotilla that greeted Discovery after the victory over Viridian.

ship_archetypes.name: U.S.S. Uhura
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Reliant-class starship utilized by Starfleet in the early 25th century.

ship_archetypes.name: Orion Vessel
ship_archetypes.flavor: A light pirate vessel used by Orion Syndicate.

ship_archetypes.name: Monaveen
ship_archetypes.flavor: A Hysperian cruiser owned by Queen Paolana utilizing a number of antiquated technologies.

ship_archetypes.name: Borg Tactical Cube
ship_archetypes.flavor: Heavily armed Borg cube that opposed the U.S.S. Voyager to stop the deployment of a nanovirus and protect the Collective.

keystones.name: Aenar Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Aenar Trait

keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Allasomorph Trait

keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Argelian Trait

keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Artist Trait

keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Astrophysicist Trait

keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Athlete Trait

keystones.name: Aurelian Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Aurelian Trait

keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Automated Unit Trait

keystones.name: Ba'ku Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Ba'ku Trait

keystones.name: Bartender Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Bartender Trait

keystones.name: Barzan Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Barzan Trait

keystones.name: Ba'ul Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Ba'ul Trait

keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Beta Annari Trait

keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Borg Trait

keystones.name: Botanist Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Botanist Trait

keystones.name: Brunali Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Brunali Trait

keystones.name: Brutal Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Brutal Trait

keystones.name: Bynar Polestar

keystones.name: Caitian Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Caitian Trait

keystones.name: Cardassian Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Cardassian Trait

keystones.name: Caregiver Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Caregiver Trait

keystones.name: Casual Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Casual Trait

keystones.name: Chameloid Polestar
keystones.flavor: Polestar which targets crew with the Chameloid Trait

keystones.name: Changeling Polestar
